2. Extend one leg forward until it is straight and your knee is unlocked.
3. Lower the leg back down with control and repeat with the other leg.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace your core, and extend the knee with controlled motion

Health benefit: Increases calf flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back keeping that leg straight and the heel pressed into the floor.
3. Lean into the wall until you feel a stretch in the back calf, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep the back heel down and spine long while leaning into the stretch

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and posterior chain for improved hip extension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Press through your heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Lower your hips back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Press through the heels, squeeze the glutes, and avoid overextending the lower back

Health benefit: Increases hip rotational mobility and stretches lower back
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and arms out to the sides.
2. Lower both knees together toward the right side until they hover or touch the floor.
3. Return to center and lower the knees to the left side.
Safety cue: Keep both shoulders on the floor and control the crossover with your obliques

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and improves hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair with hands gripping the sides and feet flat.
2. Lean back slightly and pull both knees toward your chest.
3. Extend your legs forward until almost straight and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a stable surface and place one hand lightly on it for support.
2. Place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
3. Engage your core and hold the stance, then switch the leading foot.
Safety cue: Stack hips and shoulders while holding support and fix a steady gaze for balance

Health benefit: Targets calf soleus flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back and bend both knees while keeping the back heel down.
3. Lean into the wall to feel the stretch in the lower calf, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and functional sit to stand ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in front of a chair with feet hip-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower until your butt lightly taps the chair.
3. Keep weight in your heels and chest lifted.
4. Push through your heels to stand tall and repeat.
Safety cue: Push hips back, keep knees tracking over toes, and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and enhances trunk rotational range
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with hips over knees and place one hand behind your head and the other hand on the floor.
2. Rotate your torso toward the side with the lifted elbow, opening the chest upward.
3. Return the elbow toward the floor with control.
4. Repeat the rotation for the desired reps then switch sides.
Safety cue: Square the hips, rotate through the mid back and keep the lower spine stable

Health benefit: Challenges core endurance and promotes neutral spine stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Tuck your toes and lift the knees slightly off the floor to create a hover position.
3. Hold the hover while keeping a straight line from head to tail and steady breathing.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace the core to prevent sagging or arching

Health benefit: Targets triceps strength and improves elbow extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a stable chair and place hands beside your hips with fingers pointing forward.
2. Slide your hips forward off the chair and extend your legs in front with heels on the floor.
3. Bend your elbows to lower hips toward the floor while keeping shoulders down.
4. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and lift your hips back to the start.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances core activation and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet lifted off the floor.
2. Extend one leg straight while keeping the other knee bent.
3. Alternate legs in a slow circular pedaling motion.
4. Keep your lower back resting gently on the floor throughout.
Safety cue: Keep low back pressed into the mat while moving legs slowly

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with one hand on a chair or wall for support.
2. Keep the standing leg slightly bent and lift the other leg straight out to the side.
3. Lower the lifted leg with control and repeat for the other side.
Safety cue: Stand tall and lift your leg slowly without leaning your torso

Health benefit: Boosts light cardiovascular activity and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit near the edge of a chair with feet together and hands at your sides.
2. Open your legs outward while bringing your arms out and slightly overhead.
3. Return your arms and legs to the starting position with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength with reduced shoulder strain
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy table or counter and place your hands shoulder-width apart on the edge.
2. Walk your feet back so your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Bend your elbows and lower your chest toward the surface in a controlled motion.
4. Push back up to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves ankle range of motion and promotes local circulation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall at the edge of the chair with feet flat on the floor.
2. Lift one foot a few inches off the floor and point toes.
3. Rotate the ankle slowly clockwise in smooth circles.
4. Reverse the rotation and repeat in the opposite direction.
Safety cue: Rotate the ankle slowly with control while keeping the thigh supported

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and improves core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forehead resting on folded hands.
2. Lift both legs a few inches off the floor and keep them straight.
3. Alternate quick, small kicks with each leg while maintaining height.
4. Keep the hips pressed to the floor and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases inner thigh flexibility and improves hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and bring the soles of the feet together.
2. Hold the feet with both hands and open the knees outward.
3. Gently lean forward from the hips with a straight back to deepen the stretch.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral spine and lower the knees gently while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular activity while improving upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands in front as if guarding.
2. Rotate the torso and extend a controlled jab with one arm.
3. Follow with a cross from the other arm while keeping hands up.
4. Maintain a steady rhythm and relax the shoulders between punches.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace your core, and rotate through the torso with controlled punches

Health benefit: Improves shoulder blade stability and contributes to better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Pull the shoulder blades together and down toward the spine.
3. Release the shoulders to a neutral position with control.
Safety cue: Retract shoulder blades back and down without shrugging while keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Lengthens hip flexors and reduces anterior hip tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with one knee on the floor and the other foot planted forward.
2. Tuck the pelvis and shift the hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the hip.
3. Keep the torso upright and squeeze the glutes of the trailing leg.
4. Hold the stretch and then switch to the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and promotes ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place one hand lightly on it for support.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and place the opposite foot on the inner calf or thigh.
3. Press the palms together at chest level and lift the chest, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Targets lower abdominal muscles and improves core strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Curl the knees toward the chest by lifting the hips off the floor.
3. Lower the hips and legs back down with control.
4. Keep the core engaged and avoid using momentum.
Safety cue: Curl the pelvis upward using the lower abs and perform each rep slowly and controlled

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and improves foot stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit in a chair with a towel laid flat under one foot.
2. Curl your toes to grab and pull the towel toward you.
3. Release the towel and repeat or switch feet.
Safety cue: Keep ankle stable and curl toes slowly with control

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and postural endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Begin kneeling and place forearms on the floor under your shoulders.
2. Lift hips so your body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Engage your core and keep your neck neutral.
4. Hold the position and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to knees and brace the core

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and activates shoulder stabilizing muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width and arms at your sides.
2. Lift both arms out to the sides to shoulder height with palms facing down.
3. Keep a slight bend in the elbows and a tall posture.
4. Lower the arms slowly back to your sides.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and raise arms slowly to shoulder height

Health benefit: Improves functional lower body strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in front of a chair with feet hip-width and arms forward.
2. Sit hips back and bend knees until your glutes lightly touch the chair.
3. Keep weight in the heels and chest lifted.
4. Press through the heels to stand back up.
Safety cue: Push hips back, keep chest up and control the descent without letting knees pass toes

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and promotes gentle cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright beside a wall with feet together and place one hand lightly on the wall.
2. Step sideways with one foot and shift your weight onto that foot.
3. Bring the other foot to meet the stepping foot and tap the floor.
4. Repeat the step-touch in the opposite direction while keeping light contact with the wall.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and core braced while stepping with controlled movements

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand behind a sturdy chair and hold the backrest with both hands.
2. Shift your weight onto one leg and lift the other foot a few inches off the floor.
3. Hold your balance for the desired time while keeping the standing leg slightly bent.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and weight centered over the standing foot

Health benefit: Improves spinal mobility and reduces upper back stiffness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and hands behind your head.
2. Rotate your upper torso to one side using your thoracic spine while keeping hips facing forward.
3. Hold the rotated position briefly while breathing steadily.
4. Return to center and perform the rotation to the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate from the upper back while keeping the core engaged

Health benefit: Enhances calf flexibility and ankle range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back keeping that heel flat and the back leg straight.
3. Lean forward into the wall until you feel a stretch in the back calf.
4. Switch legs and repeat the stretch on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep front knee slightly bent and press the back heel into the floor

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and supports hip stability during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width on the floor.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top and hold briefly.
4. Lower your hips slowly back to the floor.
Safety cue: Lift hips by squeezing glutes and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves calf strength and promotes ankle stability for walking
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a support and hold it lightly with both hands at hip height.
2. Rise onto the balls of your feet by lifting both heels off the ground.
3. Lower your heels back down with control and repeat the movement.
Safety cue: Rise slowly through the balls of the feet and control the descent

Health benefit: Enhances core mobility and gentle rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands resting gently on your thighs or crossed over your chest.
2. Rotate your torso to one side from the waist while keeping your hips square.
3. Return to center and rotate to the other side in a controlled manner.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and rotate from the mid back without collapsing forward

Health benefit: Improves lower body stability and lateral weight distribution control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and feet pointing forward.
2. Shift your weight to the right leg and bend the right knee.
3. Return to center and shift weight to the left leg.
4. Repeat the weight shifts in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and shift smoothly without rotating the spine

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordination between limbs
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Extend your right arm forward and your left leg back until they form a straight line.
3. Hold with hips square and core engaged.
4. Return to hands and knees and repeat with the opposite arm and leg.
Safety cue: Brace the core and extend opposite arm and leg slowly while keeping hips level

Health benefit: Improves balance and proprioceptive awareness during slow gait practice
Steps to perform:
1. Stand next to a wall and lightly rest one hand on it for support.
2. Place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the toe.
3. Take slow, deliberate steps while maintaining an upright posture.
Safety cue: Stand tall, look forward, and place each heel directly in front of the toe

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate gently while challenging hip flexor strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy support and hold it with both hands.
2. Lift your right knee slowly toward your chest while keeping your torso upright.
3. Lower the right knee and lift the left knee in the same slow manner.
4. Continue alternating knees at a controlled, marching pace.
Safety cue: Lift knees with control, keep the torso upright, and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Builds quadriceps endurance and enhances lower body isometric strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width apart about 2 feet from the wall.
2. Slide your back down the wall until your knees bend to about 90 degrees.
3. Hold the position with weight in your heels and back flat against the wall.
4. Press through your heels to stand back up.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and improves unilateral shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Get on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Extend one arm straight forward to shoulder height while keeping hips level.
3. Lower the arm back to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and lift the arm without rotating the hips

Health benefit: Raises heart rate gently and improves coordination and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Step one foot out to the side while raising both arms overhead.
3. Step the foot back to center as you lower the arms and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases hip mobility and promotes controlled hip joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand next to a stable surface and place one hand lightly for support.
2. Shift your weight to the standing leg and move the opposite hip in a circular motion.
3. Reverse the circle direction after several reps and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and perform slow controlled circles without shifting the torso

Health benefit: Improves triceps flexibility and enhances shoulder overhead range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and raise one arm overhead.
2. Bend the raised elbow and reach the hand toward the upper back.
3. Use the opposite hand to gently press the bent elbow downward.
4. Hold the stretch and then switch arms.
Safety cue: Keep the shoulder blade down and back while reaching the elbow overhead

Health benefit: Develops upper body pushing strength with reduced joint load
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands shoulder-width on a stable elevated surface.
2. Step your feet back into a straight plank line.
3. Bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the surface.
4. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and return to start.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and lower with controlled descent

Health benefit: Challenges core stability and improves seated balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a stable chair with feet flat and hands on the sides for support.
2. Lean back slightly, engage your core, and lift your feet a few inches off the floor.
3. Rock backward and forward using your core while maintaining light hand support.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and move from the core without letting the ribs flare

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring activation and increases lower body dynamic flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a stable surface and hold it lightly for balance.
2. March in place by bringing one heel up toward the glute.
3. Alternate legs rhythmically while keeping a light grip on the support.
Safety cue: Stand tall holding support and kick the heel toward the glute with controlled motion

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular muscles and supports improved upper back posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together without lifting your shoulders.
3. Hold the squeeze briefly and then release.
Safety cue: Pull the shoulder blades down and together without shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and outer thigh muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and head supported by your arm or a pillow.
2. Lift the top leg up to hip height with toes pointing forward and knee straight.
3. Lower the top leg slowly without letting it touch the bottom leg.
4. Repeat the lift for the desired number of repetitions.
Safety cue: Stack your hips and brace the core to prevent rolling

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and coordinated reach control while maintaining balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a chair or wall and place one hand on it for support.
2. Place feet hip-width and step the working foot forward to a 12 o'clock position.
3. Reach the opposite arm forward toward the stepped foot while keeping the torso upright.
4. Return to center and repeat reaches to other clock positions as needed.
Safety cue: Keep a tall spine and reach with control from your supporting hand

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder endurance and core rotational stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent, hands held at chin level.
2. Rotate the torso and extend the right fist across the midline in a controlled motion.
3. Return the right hand to the start and alternate by punching with the left fist.
Safety cue: Rotate through the torso and keep the core braced during each punch

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and improves torso flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair or mat with both feet flat on the floor.
2. Place the right hand on the outside of the left thigh and the left hand behind you on the seat or floor.
3. Rotate the torso to the left using the hands for gentle leverage and hold the position.
Safety cue: Sit tall, lengthen the spine, and initiate the twist from the mid back

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and ankle stability with supported alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and place one hand on it for light support.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and place the sole of the opposite foot on the inner calf or thigh.
3. Bring the free hand to the chest or overhead and lengthen the spine while balancing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes pelvic mobility and encourages gentle core muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Tilt the pelvis posteriorly to flatten the lower back against the floor while engaging the abdominals.
3. Release to a neutral spine and repeat the tilting motion slowly.
Safety cue: Tilt from the pelvis with slow controlled breaths and avoid thrusting the hips

Health benefit: Enhances scapular stability and upper back muscle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms overhead in a Y and palms facing down.
2. Squeeze shoulder blades and lift arms and chest a few inches off the ground.
3. Hold for a second while keeping the neck neutral.
4. Lower slowly back to the ground with control.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and lift through the shoulder blades with controlled motion

Health benefit: Builds quadriceps strength and enhances knee joint control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall in a chair with feet flat and hands on the sides.
2. Extend one leg forward until the knee is straight but not locked.
3. Hold for a second and squeeze the quadriceps.
4. Lower the foot back to the floor with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Extend the leg slowly keeping the knee soft and core braced

Health benefit: Activates core muscles and enhances pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Lift shoulders slightly and reach one hand to tap the outer side of the same-side heel.
3. Return to center and alternate taps on the other side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep lower back grounded and hinge from the hips for slow controlled heel taps

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and balance with assisted support
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall holding onto a stable surface for support.
2. Step one foot back and lower the back knee toward the floor into a lunge.
3. Push through the front heel to return the back foot to the starting position.
4. Repeat on the opposite leg while maintaining an upright torso.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and cardiovascular fitness with low joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Step one foot diagonally behind the other while swinging the opposite arm across the body.
3. Push off and step to the opposite side, keeping movements smooth and low impact.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and drive lateral movement from the hips

Health benefit: Increases thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and arms extended in front at shoulder height.
2. Keep hips stacked and rotate the top arm across the body, opening the chest.
3. Hold the position, then return the arm and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the thoracic spine with slow controlled breathing

Health benefit: Stretches hip external rotators and reduces glute tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Cross one ankle over the opposite knee to form a figure four.
3. Thread your hands behind the uncrossed thigh and pull it gently toward your chest.
4. Hold briefly, then switch legs and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg with a slight bend in the supporting knee.
2. Place the sole of the opposite foot against the inner calf or ankle, avoiding the knee.
3. Bring hands to the hips or chest and hold balance, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds upper body strength and shoulder stability through isometric activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place palms on the wall at chest height and press firmly.
3. Hold the press while engaging your core and breathe.
Safety cue: Brace core and press evenly through both palms keeping spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances cross-body coordination and motor pattern integration for improved balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift your right knee and bring your left elbow toward it.
3. Lower and return to standing.
4. Repeat on the opposite side in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Stand tall and move opposite arm and leg with controlled rhythm

Health benefit: Promotes hip extension range of motion and quadriceps lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with your right knee on the floor and left foot forward in a lunge.
2. Tuck your pelvis slightly and shift your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the right hip.
3. Keep your torso upright and engage your core.
4. Switch legs and repeat the sequence.
Safety cue: Posteriorly tilt the pelvis and gently shift hips forward while keeping torso upright

Health benefit: Enhances ankle stability and dynamic balance during gait
Steps to perform:
1. Stand at one end of a straight line or imaginary line.
2. Place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the toe each step.
3. Walk slowly along the line while focusing on steady balance.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular retractors and improves shoulder posture and stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forehead on the mat and arms by your sides forming a W.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your hands and chest slightly off the ground.
3. Hold the lifted position while keeping elbows bent and palms down.
4. Lower slowly and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and squeeze shoulder blades down and together as you lift

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor power and dynamic balance while enhancing coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands up for balance and weight on your supporting leg.
2. Lift the knee of the kicking leg toward hip height.
3. Extend the foot forward in a controlled low kick.
4. Retract the foot and place it back, then repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Brace core and extend the kicking leg with control without leaning back

Health benefit: Improves scapular control and shoulder stability through controlled protraction and retraction
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with hands on the wall at shoulder height and arms straight.
2. Keep arms straight and squeeze shoulder blades together to lower your chest slightly toward the wall.
3. Push through your hands to spread the shoulder blades apart and return to the start.
Safety cue: Keep arms straight and move only through the scapula by protracting and retracting with control

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic extension and shoulder mobility while gently opening the chest
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hips above knees and hands forward.
2. Walk your hands forward and lower your chest toward the floor while keeping hips raised.
3. Rest your forehead or chin on the mat and breathe while holding the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked above knees and reach forward while maintaining a long neutral spine

Health benefit: Develops single leg posterior chain strength and balance with improved hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand holding a stable support with one hand and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Hinge at the hips with a slight bend in the standing knee and extend the other leg back.
3. Lower your torso until you feel a stretch in the standing hamstring while keeping your back flat.
4. Drive your hips forward to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and enhances posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips or a support.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and keep the standing knee soft.
3. Lift the other leg straight back without bending the knee.
4. Lower the lifted leg with control and repeat for reps.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and hinge from the glutes with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms relaxed at sides.
2. Step laterally to the right while swinging both arms across the body.
3. Step back to center and swing arms out to the sides.
4. Repeat the step and swing to the left.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright chest and control the arm swing with your core

Health benefit: Enhances upper back mobility and posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with feet flat and hands behind the head.
2. Tuck the chin slightly and brace the core.
3. Open the chest and arch the upper back over the chair back.
4. Return to neutral with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall and open the chest while initiating movement from the upper back

Health benefit: Increases elbow and triceps flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall and raise one arm overhead.
2. Bend the raised elbow and reach the hand down the back.
3. Use the opposite hand to gently press the elbow.
4. Hold the stretch and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Keep the neck long and pull the elbow gently toward the head without forcing

Health benefit: Improves core engagement and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on knees and forearms with elbows under shoulders.
2. Step feet back and keep knees on the floor with a straight line from head to knees.
3. Engage the core and avoid sagging hips.
4. Hold the position for the desired time while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Brace the core and keep a straight line from knees to head

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder range of motion and spinal elongation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at sides.
2. Reach one arm overhead while slightly leaning to the opposite side.
3. Lower that arm and repeat on the other side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Exhale as you reach up and avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances wrist mobility and joint lubrication
Steps to perform:
1. Extend arms in front at shoulder height with palms down.
2. Make slow circular motions with the wrists in one direction.
3. Reverse the direction and repeat the circles the same number of times.
Safety cue: Move slowly through the full range and control the motion from the wrist

Health benefit: Opens hips and encourages gentle lower back relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Reach hands toward the outside of the knees or shins.
3. Gently pull knees toward the armpits while keeping the spine on the floor.
4. Hold the position and breathe deeply for several breaths.
Safety cue: Keep the lower back gently grounded and move with controlled breaths

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor control and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Bend the other knee and grab the shin or behind the thigh with both hands.
3. Pull the knee toward the chest while keeping the standing leg slightly bent and balance.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Targets inner thighs and glutes to strengthen lower body
Steps to perform:
1. Stand wide with toes turned outward and feet wider than shoulder-width.
2. Lower hips back and down until thighs reach near parallel to the floor.
3. Keep chest up and knees tracking over the toes.
4. Push through the heels to return to standing.
Safety cue: Drive hips back, keep chest tall and knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances hand eye coordination and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot slightly forward and hands raised at chin level.
2. Strike the speed bag using loose wrists in rapid alternating taps.
3. Keep elbows close and wrists relaxed while maintaining a steady rhythm.
4. Continue small circular motions with consistent light taps.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders relaxed and control the circular motion from the wrists

Health benefit: Promotes hip and groin flexibility and relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and bring the soles of your feet together.
2. Let the knees fall open to the sides in a butterfly position.
3. Rest your arms by your sides and relax the hips.
Safety cue: Draw the belly toward the spine and keep the lower back gently on the mat

Health benefit: Strengthens shin muscles and improves ankle dorsiflexion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift your toes off the ground so only heels contact the floor.
2. Take small steps forward walking on your heels.
3. Maintain an upright posture and controlled steps.
Safety cue: Keep toes pointed up and maintain an upright posture

Health benefit: Improves lateral hip stability and glute engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Step one foot diagonally behind into a shallow curtsy while bending both knees slightly.
3. Keep your torso upright and your front knee aligned over the ankle.
4. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep front knee aligned over the ankle and torso upright

Health benefit: Improves coordination and activates hip flexors and core
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a low step with feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift one foot and tap the toe onto the step, then lower it back down.
3. Alternate feet rapidly while keeping light, controlled taps.
Safety cue: Control each tap with a steady tempo and keep hips level

Health benefit: Enhances ankle mobility and neuromuscular control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or lie with one leg extended and the foot relaxed.
2. Pull the toes and foot up toward the shin using the ankle muscles.
3. Lower the foot back to neutral with control.
Safety cue: Pull toes toward the shin with controlled movement and keep the ankle steady

Health benefit: Lengthens hamstring muscles and improves posterior chain flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the edge of a chair and extend one leg straight.
2. Flex the extended foot and hinge forward from the hips toward the toes.
3. Keep the spine long and reach toward the foot.
4. Return to upright and switch to the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep the spine long and hinge at the hips to reach toward the shin

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and enhances balance during gait
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and rise onto the balls of both feet.
2. Walk forward on your toes using short, controlled steps.
3. Keep heels elevated and maintain an upright torso.
Safety cue: Rise onto the balls of the feet with knees soft and maintain a tall chest

Health benefit: Enhances spinal stability and shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Extend one arm forward until it is parallel to the floor.
3. Hold the lifted arm and keep the spine neutral.
4. Lower the arm with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you lift the arm

Health benefit: Improves lateral core strength and trunk flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands behind your head.
2. Lift one knee toward the same-side elbow while bending the torso sideways.
3. Lower the leg and torso with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Brace your core, keep ribs down and crunch from the waist

Health benefit: Increases hip internal and external rotation mobility and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with both knees bent at 90 degrees and shins stacked in front of you.
2. Place hands on the floor for support and brace your core.
3. Rotate your hips to lift the top knee and switch legs so the other shin becomes on top.
4. Continue switching sides with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Press lower back gently into the mat and rotate from the hips

Health benefit: Lengthens quadriceps and supports knee flexion range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Bend the opposite knee and grasp the ankle or foot behind you.
3. Pull the foot toward the glutes and keep the knees close together.
Safety cue: Stand tall, keep ribs down and pull heel toward glute without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and rhythmic movement patterning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step one foot diagonally to the side.
2. Cross the opposite foot behind the first foot and step laterally again.
3. Cross the first foot in front and continue stepping laterally with rhythm.
4. Repeat the pattern moving smoothly in the same direction.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright chest and step with control while keeping weight even

Health benefit: Enhances lateral hip strength and functional step stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and step one foot out wide to the side.
2. Bend the lead knee while keeping the trailing leg mostly straight and chest up.
3. Push through the lead heel to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Push hips back, keep the stepping knee tracking over the foot and chest upright

Health benefit: Strengthens hamstrings and improves knee joint control during gait
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hold onto a support for balance.
2. Bend one knee and curl the heel toward the glutes slowly.
3. Lower the foot with control and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Hinge slightly at the hips and curl the heel toward the glute with control

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic mobility and multi joint movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forward lunge with the front knee bent and hands on the inside of the front foot.
2. Rotate the torso and reach the same-side arm up toward the ceiling.
3. Return the hand to the floor and drop the hips toward the front heel.
4. Step the feet together and switch sides with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases shoulder external rotation and upper back flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and raise one arm overhead then bend the elbow to reach down the back.
2. Reach the opposite arm behind the lower back and try to clasp the fingers.
3. Hold the stretch and then switch arm positions.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and draw shoulder blades down as you reach hands together

Health benefit: Improves hip abductor strength and single leg balance capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg while keeping the standing knee slightly bent.
2. Lift the other leg out to the side with toes pointing forward and hips level.
3. Lower the leg with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee soft, hips squared and lift the leg slowly with control

Health benefit: Builds chest strength while activating glutes and posterior chain
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and a weight held over your chest.
2. Drive hips upward into a bridge so your torso forms a straight line from knees to shoulders.
3. Lower the weight to your chest while keeping hips lifted.
4. Press the weight up until arms are extended and maintain the bridge.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep a neutral spine while pressing the weight

Health benefit: Promotes balance and light cardiovascular activity through wide stepping movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. March in place by lifting each knee toward hip height while keeping feet wide.
3. Drive opposite arms in sync with the stepping motion.
Safety cue: Walk with an upright torso and take controlled short steps

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and joint awareness through controlled circular motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands on your hips.
2. Rotate your hips in a large controlled circle in one direction.
3. Reverse the direction and repeat the hip circles.
Safety cue: Keep a tall spine and move the hip slowly with control

Health benefit: Improves hamstring and inner thigh flexibility and seated range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs spread wide and knees straight.
2. Keep a tall spine and hinge forward from the hips.
3. Reach both hands toward your feet or the center line.
4. Hold the forward position without rounding your back.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a long spine and avoid rounding

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and reinforces hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hands behind your head or on your hips.
2. Hinge forward at the hips while pushing your glutes back and keeping a neutral spine.
3. Lower your torso until it is near parallel to the floor.
4. Return to standing by driving hips forward and squeezing the glutes.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a soft knee bend and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Targets glute activation and hip extension for improved posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and soles of the feet together in a frog shape.
2. Press through your heels and squeeze your glutes to lift your hips into a bridge.
3. Lower the hips back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Squeeze your glutes at the top and lower with control to avoid arching the back

Health benefit: Promotes ankle mobility and activates lower leg muscles for functional movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place one heel forward with the toe up and the other foot planted.
2. Press the forward heel into the floor as you extend the ankle and hold briefly.
3. Pull the heel back to the start and alternate sides with a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the floor and perform each rep with control

Health benefit: Stretches adductor muscles and enhances hip mobility through controlled rocking
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with one knee turned out and the foot flat beside your hand.
2. Shift your hips back toward the heel of the bent leg to load the inner thigh.
3. Return to the starting position and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Hinge back from the hips keeping hips level and controlled

Health benefit: Encourages gentle spinal extension and anterior torso opening with low intensity
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your stomach with forearms on the floor and elbows under shoulders.
2. Press forearms into the floor and lift your chest to create a gentle backbend.
3. Keep hips and legs relaxed on the floor and hold the pose.
Safety cue: Lengthen through the spine and breathe steadily while keeping shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance while strengthening hamstrings and hip stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with one fingertip lightly touching it for balance.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and hinge forward at the hips while lifting the opposite leg straight back.
3. Keep a neutral spine and reach toward the floor with the hands or a weight.
4. Drive hips forward to return to standing and switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances triceps strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place hands in a diamond shape under your chest.
2. Step back so your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Bend elbows and lower your chest toward the wall keeping elbows close.
4. Push through your palms to return to the start position.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and elbows tracking close to the ribs

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms out to the sides and legs together.
2. Lift legs toward the ceiling as high as comfortable.
3. Lower legs to one side and smoothly swing them to the other side like a pendulum.
Safety cue: Control the swing with your core and hinge from the hips, not the lower back

Health benefit: Increases core rotational mobility and oblique engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair and hold the seat for support.
2. Lift both knees and bring shins parallel to the floor.
3. Rotate knees together from side to side like windshield wipers.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders grounded and move knees slowly using core control

Health benefit: Enhances hip external rotation and glute flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit sideways on a chair and place one ankle on the opposite knee.
2. Square your hips and sit tall with a long spine.
3. Hinge forward from the hips and lower your torso toward the front leg.
4. Hold the position.
Safety cue: Square the hips forward and maintain a long spine as you hinge from the hips

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and whole body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one foot.
2. Reach both arms out to the sides at shoulder height.
3. Extend the opposite leg straight out to the side or slightly back.
4. Hold the balanced position with a steady gaze.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall spine and focus on a fixed point to stabilize the stance

Health benefit: Promotes scapular mobility and posterior shoulder activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms by your sides and palms facing the floor.
2. Lift your chest and arms a few inches off the ground while keeping your neck neutral.
3. Sweep your arms out to the sides and overhead toward your ears in a controlled arc.
4. Return your arms to your sides slowly.
Safety cue: Keep the forehead anchored and move the shoulders slowly, initiating from the scapulae

Health benefit: Supports thoracic extension and shoulder mobility during reaching movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and bring hands up near your chin.
2. Rotate your torso and punch diagonally upward with one arm while extending the other for balance.
3. Retract the punch and repeat with the opposite arm.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves scapular upward rotation and shoulder blade control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place forearms on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Press your forearms into the wall and draw your shoulder blades down and together.
3. Slide your forearms upward along the wall as high as comfortable while keeping contact.
4. Lower your forearms back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Keep forearms and wrists contacting the wall and initiate movement from the scapulae

Health benefit: Enhances biceps and anterior shoulder flexibility for improved range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and place the palm of the nearest hand on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Rotate your torso away from the wall to feel a stretch along the front of the upper arm.
3. Hold the stretch and then return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep the chest open and avoid shrugging the shoulder as you lean into the stretch

Health benefit: Builds hip flexor endurance and core stability during isometric hold
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and engage your core.
2. Lift one knee up to hip level and hold it there with control.
3. Maintain balance while holding the knee at hip height.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral pelvis and engage the lower abs to prevent lumbar arching

Health benefit: Improves core stability and shoulder coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a kneeling plank with hands under shoulders and knees on the ground.
2. Brace your core and keep hips stable and square.
3. Lift one hand and tap the opposite shoulder while avoiding hip rotation.
4. Return the hand and repeat on the other side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced while tapping each shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and low impact cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet together with arms at your sides.
2. Step one foot out to the side while sweeping both arms out and overhead.
3. Step the same foot back to center while lowering arms to your sides.
4. Repeat the movement alternating sides at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and control the arm sweep through the full range

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and posture alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and eyes forward.
2. Push your chin straight forward without tilting the head.
3. Pull your chin straight back to align the ears over the shoulders and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the chin slightly tucked and perform slow controlled neck protraction and retraction

Health benefit: Increases inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor and open your legs into a wide V with toes pointing up.
2. Sit tall and hinge forward from the hips with a flat back.
3. Reach both hands toward one foot while keeping the opposite leg active.
4. Return to center and repeat the reach toward the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a long spine and hinge forward from the hips

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and ankle proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place one foot directly in front of the other, heel to toe.
2. Lift your arms out to the sides and focus on a fixed point.
3. Shift weight slowly forward and backward to challenge balance.
4. Switch lead foot and repeat the sequence.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, gaze steady, and engage the core to control balance

Health benefit: Builds unilateral glute strength and pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and the other leg extended straight.
2. Press through the heel of the bent leg and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Squeeze the glute of the supporting leg at the top.
4. Lower hips back down with control and repeat before switching legs.
Safety cue: Drive through the heel, keep hips level, and squeeze the glute at the top

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Hop a small distance to the right, landing softly on both feet with knees bent.
3. Immediately hop the same small distance to the left and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and control each lateral hop

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or lie down with the leg extended and the foot relaxed.
2. Point your toes away from you to perform plantarflexion.
3. Pull your toes back toward your shin to perform dorsiflexion and repeat.
Safety cue: Control the motion and move the foot deliberately while keeping the lower leg stable

Health benefit: Enhances spinal rotation and hip flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with one leg bent and the other leg crossed over so the ankle rests near the opposite knee.
2. Hug the crossed knee and sit tall to lengthen the spine.
3. Rotate your torso toward the crossed leg using your hands for gentle leverage.
4. Release the twist, switch sides, and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the spine long and rotate from the thorax while avoiding lower back rounding

Health benefit: Promotes hip dynamic flexibility and movement preparation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and place one hand lightly on it for balance.
2. Swing the outside leg across your body and then out to the side in a controlled arc.
3. Maintain an upright torso and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso and control the swing from the hip

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and improves single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold onto a stable support.
2. Step one leg diagonally behind the other into a curtsy position.
3. Lower into a squat by bending both knees while keeping chest upright.
4. Push through the front heel to return to start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and ensure the front knee tracks over the toes

Health benefit: Improves pelvic alignment and core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and soften the knees.
2. Tuck the tailbone under and contract the lower abdominal muscles.
3. Release back to neutral and repeat with controlled movements.
Safety cue: Engage lower abs and keep ribs stacked over hips

Health benefit: Increases lateral flexibility and trunk mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width and reach one arm overhead.
2. Lean to the opposite side until a stretch is felt along the side body.
3. Hold briefly, return to center, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and reach through the top arm to lengthen the side body

Health benefit: Enhances proprioception and walking balance
Steps to perform:
1. Pretend a straight line on the floor and place one foot directly in front of the other.
2. Keep eyes forward, shoulders relaxed, and arms out for balance.
3. Take slow, deliberate steps placing heel to toe each time.
4. Continue across the line and turn carefully by stepping to the side.
Safety cue: Fix your gaze ahead and walk with a tall, controlled posture

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and toes with hips low and knees hovering just above the floor.
2. Spread fingers, press into the ground, and keep the core engaged.
3. Hold the position while breathing steadily for the desired time.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders over wrists and maintain a neutral spine while hovering knees

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor activation and running mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and engage your core.
2. Drive one knee up toward the chest using the hip flexors.
3. Lower the foot back down with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Drive the knee up with control while keeping the torso upright and core braced

Health benefit: Enhances rib cage mobility and postural alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands resting on the rib cage.
2. Gently shift the rib cage to one side without moving the hips.
3. Return to center and repeat the movement to the other side.
Safety cue: Stabilize the pelvis and shift the rib cage without shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Increases wrist flexibility and range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm in front with palm facing down.
2. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the fingers back toward the forearm.
3. Hold the stretch and then switch to the other wrist.
Safety cue: Support the forearm and gently extend the wrist with controlled pressure

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and improves ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall near a support and lift one foot off the ground.
2. Rise onto the ball of the standing foot by pushing through the calf.
3. Hold the top position for the prescribed time while keeping balance.
4. Lower the heel with control and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep the supporting knee slightly bent and raise the heel with ankle control

Health benefit: Improves posterior shoulder strength and scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on a mat with arms extended out to the sides at shoulder level.
2. Lift both arms off the ground while squeezing the shoulder blades together.
3. Hold the raised position for 1�2 seconds.
4. Lower the arms slowly back to the mat.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and retract the shoulder blades as you raise the arms

Health benefit: Enhances trunk rotational control and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a weight with both hands by one shoulder.
2. Rotate your torso and slowly bring the weight diagonally down across the body toward the opposite hip.
3. Pause and keep the movement controlled.
4. Reverse the path slowly back to the start position.
Safety cue: Rotate from the hips and keep the core braced throughout the chop

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and upper body movement readiness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms extended straight out at shoulder height.
2. Swing both arms together across the chest until the elbows meet or cross.
3. Swing the arms back out to the sides with control.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and control the swing with your shoulders and core

Health benefit: Improves ankle flexibility and calf muscle length
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back with the knee bent and press the back heel into the floor.
3. Hold the stretch and switch sides.
Safety cue: Bend the back knee and press the heel down to feel the soleus stretch

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a chair and place one hand on the chair for support.
2. Hinge at the hip and lift the back leg until your torso and raised leg form a straight line.
3. Extend the free arm out to the side for balance.
4. Hold the position and keep the supporting knee slightly bent.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips, maintain a flat back and control your balance using the support

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral hip muscles and improves side to side mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and hands at chest level.
2. Shift your weight to one leg and push your hips back as you bend that knee into a lateral lunge.
3. Keep the other leg straight and both feet flat on the floor.
4. Drive through the bent foot to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves dynamic hip power and coordination during lateral movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge slightly at the hips with knees soft.
2. Swing both arms and the hips together from side to side like carving turns.
3. Keep the core engaged and control each swing.
Safety cue: Soften the knees, hinge from the hips and control each swing with deliberate tempo

Health benefit: Increases hip joint mobility and improves deep squat range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair with one foot flat on the floor and the other knee bent and open.
2. Place your elbow or hand against the inside of the raised knee.
3. Gently press outward while leaning slightly forward to increase the movement.
4. Release and switch sides.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace the core and drive the knee outward with controlled movement

Health benefit: Improves posterior neck flexibility and reduces neck stiffness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and interlace your fingers at the base of your skull.
2. Gently tuck your chin and guide your head forward with your hands.
3. Hold the stretch and breathe normally.
Safety cue: Tuck the chin slightly and gently lengthen the back of the neck without forcing

Health benefit: Develops single leg balance and ankle proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one foot.
2. Bend the opposite knee and lift the foot to touch the standing calf or ankle.
3. Keep the hips level and hold the balance.
Safety cue: Find a fixed gaze, keep hips level and engage the standing leg for steady balance

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral leg strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Place your front foot forward and set your rear foot on a stable support or slightly behind.
2. Hold a support with one hand and keep your torso upright.
3. Lower your hips until the front thigh is about parallel to the floor.
4. Push through the front heel to return to the start.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and torso upright during the descent

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and coordination while promoting hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Step one foot back into a small lunge while sweeping your arms overhead.
3. Step the foot back to center and lower your arms.
4. Repeat on the opposite side in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and maintain a tall spine

Health benefit: Increases thoracic mobility and rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand perpendicular to a wall and place your forearm on the wall at chest height.
2. Keep your hips facing forward and rotate your torso away from the wall.
3. Hold the rotated position briefly then return and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Rotate through the thoracic spine while keeping hips and pelvis still

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor and quadriceps flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with one knee on the floor and the other foot planted forward.
2. Tuck your pelvis under and shift your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the kneeling hip.
3. Keep your chest upright and hold the position.
4. Return to neutral and switch sides.
Safety cue: Tuck the pelvis and hinge from the hips to control the stretch

Health benefit: Strengthens deep neck flexors and improves neck posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Gently tuck your chin toward your chest without lifting your head from the surface.
3. Hold the tucked position briefly, then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Retract the chin slowly while keeping the head on the floor

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles and enhances hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Keep the knee bent and lift one leg up toward the ceiling by contracting the glute.
3. Squeeze at the top while maintaining a neutral spine.
4. Lower the knee back to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hip and drive the heel up while maintaining a neutral spine

Health benefit: Increases cardiovascular endurance while improving shoulder mobility and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and hands at chest level.
2. Step your right foot out wide while moving your arms outward and clap in front of your chest.
3. Step feet back together and return your arms to chest level; repeat alternating sides.
Safety cue: Step with control and keep your chest lifted to avoid spinal rotation

Health benefit: Relieves neck and shoulder tension and improves range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and place one hand behind your back.
2. Use your free hand to gently guide your head toward the opposite shoulder.
3. Hold the stretch, then release and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep the shoulder down and tilt the head away to lengthen the upper neck

Health benefit: Challenges balance and proprioception while enhancing ankle and hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place one foot directly behind the other in a heel-to-toe position.
2. Slowly take a controlled step backward onto the heel of the rear foot while keeping your gaze steady.
3. Continue slow heel-to-toe steps backward for the desired distance, then switch starting foot.
Safety cue: Take slow controlled steps with hips level and core engaged

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior neck muscles and enhances neck endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and place both hands on the back of your head.
2. Attempt to push your head backward while resisting the movement with your hands to create tension.
3. Hold the isometric contraction for the target time, then relax.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and press gently into resistance without moving the head

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Keep the knee bent and lift one knee out to the side to hip height.
3. Squeeze the outer glute at the top.
4. Lower the knee back under control to the start position.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and pelvis stable as you lift the leg

Health benefit: Activates hamstrings while improving lower limb coordination and rhythmic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and core engaged.
2. March in place, lifting each heel toward the same-side glute.
3. Pump the opposite arm and keep a light, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Stand tall, keep core engaged, and control each knee drive to avoid bouncing

Health benefit: Increases neck lateral flexibility and relieves upper shoulder tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and back straight.
2. Rotate the head slightly toward the opposite shoulder.
3. Tilt the chin down toward the chest and into the armpit.
4. Use the same-side hand to gently pull the head deeper and hold.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and ankle proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one foot.
2. Lift the other foot and place it against the inner calf or ankle.
3. Keep eyes open, hips level, and hold the balance.
Safety cue: Stand on one leg with hips level, a soft standing knee, and a steady gaze

Health benefit: Builds anti rotation core strength and improves trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand side-on to the band or cable anchor with feet hip-width.
2. Hold the handle at chest height with both hands and elbows bent.
3. Press the handle straight out and resist rotation with the core.
4. Pull the handle back to the chest with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and strengthens hip abductors with low impact conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Start in an athletic stance with knees slightly bent.
2. Take a slow lateral step with one foot followed by the trailing foot.
3. Keep a low center of gravity and use short, controlled steps.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases upper back mobility and promotes improved thoracic posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and place the chair back at mid-upper back level.
2. Interlace fingers behind the head and keep elbows wide.
3. Lean back over the chair top to extend the upper spine.
4. Return to upright with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances hamstring flexibility and improves posterior chain lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Place one heel on a low step or raised surface with the toe up.
2. Keep the standing leg slightly bent and hinge at the hips.
3. Reach toward the raised toe with a long spine and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves multidirectional single leg balance and movement awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other knee slightly bent.
2. Tap the toe to a chosen clock position (for example 12, 3, 6, 9) with control.
3. Return the toe to center after each tap.
4. Repeat taps across the selected clock positions.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder and back muscles to support improved spinal alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms resting alongside the body and palms down.
2. Squeeze glutes and lift the chest slightly while keeping the neck neutral.
3. Hold the lifted position briefly, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lower body strength and functional stair climbing ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall facing a low step with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step up onto the step with one foot and press through the heel to lift the body.
3. Lower the trailing foot back down with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Drive through the heel of the foot on the step and keep hips level

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and lateral stability during side-to-side movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand sideways beside a low step with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step up laterally onto the step with the nearest foot and press through the heel.
3. Lower the other foot back down with control and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and ensure the stepping knee tracks over the toes

Health benefit: Enhances neck lateral mobility and range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and eyes forward.
2. Tilt the head toward one shoulder using neck muscles to bring the ear closer to the shoulder.
3. Hold the lateral tilt while keeping the opposite shoulder down.
4. Return to neutral and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances core engagement and hip flexor endurance during balance tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips or at sides.
2. Lift one knee toward hip height while keeping the torso upright and core engaged.
3. Hold the lifted position, then lower the foot back to the floor and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Brace your core and lift the knee to hip height while keeping hips level

Health benefit: Increases hip joint mobility and coordination through controlled circular motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands on hips and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Lift one knee slightly and initiate a smooth circular motion from the hip joint.
3. Complete several clockwise circles while keeping the torso stable.
4. Reverse the direction and repeat with the other hip.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall spine and move the hip slowly with controlled range

Health benefit: Builds chest isometric strength and shoulder stability without joint movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall at arm's length with palms flat at chest height.
2. Press both palms into the wall without letting the torso move and squeeze the chest muscles.
3. Hold the press, then release the pressure and relax the arms.
Safety cue: Press evenly into the wall with both hands and keep shoulders down and back

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and balance with low impact stepping
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Step sideways onto one foot while sliding the other foot behind and across, shifting weight smoothly.
3. Push back to the starting position and repeat the motion to the opposite side.
Safety cue: Step laterally with control and land softly with knees slightly bent

Health benefit: Stretches outer hip and gluteal muscles to enhance hip flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair or mat and cross one ankle over the opposite thigh near the knee.
2. Keep the spine long and flex the crossed foot to protect the knee.
3. Lean forward from the hips with a flat back until you feel a stretch in the outer hip.
4. Hold the position, then uncross and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall and hinge forward from the hips while keeping a neutral spine

Health benefit: Promotes ankle mobility and foot proprioception for improved balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Shift weight back onto the heels so toes lift slightly, then rock forward onto the toes lifting the heels.
3. Continue alternating the heel-toe rocking with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Rock slowly between heel and toe while keeping the ankle aligned under the knee

Health benefit: Builds core coordination and control for safer movement patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent at 90 degrees and feet lifted off the floor.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back gently into the floor.
3. Slowly extend one leg toward the floor without letting the lower back arch.
4. Return the leg to the start and repeat with the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed into the floor and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Strengthens hamstrings and improves single-leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall next to a support and place light weight on the opposite hand.
2. Bend one knee and curl the heel toward your glute.
3. Lower the foot with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Control the knee bend and avoid swinging the hip

Health benefit: Enhances lateral hip mobility and coordination for improved movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step the right foot wide to the side with a slow controlled motion.
3. Cross the left foot behind the right foot and step right again.
4. Reverse the sequence to the left at the same slow tempo.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and place each step with control

Health benefit: Increases wrist and forearm flexibility for better range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm straight in front with the palm facing up.
2. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the fingers and palm downward.
3. Hold the stretch and then switch arms.
Safety cue: Keep forearm aligned with the wrist and avoid shrugging the shoulder

Health benefit: Improves standing balance and shoulder mobility within a controlled range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms at your sides.
2. Lift one arm and the opposite leg slightly outward to form a small star shape.
3. Lower both limbs with control back to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core engaged

Health benefit: Enhances scapular control and contributes to improved shoulder positioning
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands resting on your thighs.
2. Draw your shoulder blades down away from your ears without shrugging.
3. Hold the depressed position briefly and then relax.
Safety cue: Sit tall and actively pull the shoulder blades down

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles and supports hip extension strength during standing movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand holding a stable support and transfer weight to one leg.
2. Keep the working knee bent and drive the heel back while squeezing the glute.
3. Lower the leg with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and hinge from the hip while squeezing the glute

Health benefit: Challenges dynamic balance and agility while improving hip mobility and stepping coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a low box or step facing along its length.
2. Step one foot onto the box and shift your weight forward onto that foot.
3. Step the other foot over the box and place it down on the far side.
4. Step down to the starting side and repeat leading with the opposite foot.
Safety cue: Step fully onto the box and keep a controlled upright torso

Health benefit: Improves pelvic mobility and movement awareness to enhance core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and hands on your thighs.
2. Tilt your pelvis forward to the 12 o�clock position and then tilt it backward to 6 o�clock.
3. Move slowly through the 3 and 9 o�clock positions while keeping your spine neutral.
4. Continue cycling the pelvic positions in a slow, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and move the pelvis slowly with controlled breaths

Health benefit: Stretches the chest and anterior shoulder to increase upper body flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a corner and place your forearms on each wall at shoulder height.
2. Lean your chest toward the corner until you feel a stretch across the front of your shoulders and chest.
3. Hold the position and then step back to release.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and gently retract the shoulder blades

Health benefit: Builds hamstring and glute strength and enhances single-leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee of the supporting leg.
2. Hinge at the hips and extend the other leg straight back while keeping your back flat.
3. Lower your torso until it is parallel to the floor and reach toward the ground.
4. Squeeze the glute of the standing leg and drive the hips forward to return upright.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and keep a neutral spine throughout the movement

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and supports core and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, feet flat, and hands placed behind you by your hips.
2. Press through your hands and heels to lift your hips until your torso forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Keep your neck neutral and hold the lifted position.
4. Lower your hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Press through hands and heels to keep hips aligned with shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and provides low-impact full-body movement practice
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing an imaginary ladder with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step forward with one foot and reach the opposite hand upward as if grabbing a rung.
3. Pull the knee of the stepping leg up toward your chest while lowering the reaching hand.
4. Alternate sides in a controlled climbing motion.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move arms and legs deliberately without twisting

Health benefit: Increases trapezius endurance and promotes neck and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift both shoulders straight up toward your ears in a controlled motion.
3. Lower your shoulders back down slowly and repeat.
Safety cue: Raise and lower your shoulders slowly while keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Lengthens lateral thigh tissue and improves hip joint flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright and cross your right leg behind your left leg.
2. Lean your torso to the left and push your hips to the right until you feel a stretch along the outer right thigh.
3. Hold the stretch, then switch legs and repeat on the other side.
