Safety cue: Square your hips and hinge forward from the hips without rotating the torso

Health benefit: Enhances hip abductor strength and lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs straight and head supported by your lower arm.
2. Lift the top leg to hip height while keeping your hips stacked.
3. Hold the raised position isometrically then lower the leg with control.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced to prevent pelvic drop

Health benefit: Strengthens anterior lower leg muscles and supports ankle dorsiflexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with hands on the wall at shoulder height and feet a few inches back.
2. Keep your heels down and pull your toes upward toward your shins.
3. Hold the dorsiflexed position briefly.
4. Lower your toes back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Anchor the heel and lift the toes with controlled dorsiflexion while staying upright

Health benefit: Increases shoulder joint mobility and warms surrounding musculature
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit upright and bend your elbows so forearms are in front of you at 90 degrees.
2. Rotate your elbows forward in small, controlled circles for the desired repetitions.
3. Reverse the direction and rotate your elbows backward with the same control.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and perform small controlled circles from the elbows

Health benefit: Enhances wrist and forearm flexibility and promotes shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and bring your palms together behind your lower back with fingers pointing down.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and lift your chest while keeping your palms pressed.
3. Hold the reverse prayer position then release.
Safety cue: Keep the spine neutral and shoulders down while gently drawing the shoulder blades together

Health benefit: Strengthens hip flexors and challenges balance and core stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift one knee to hip height with the torso upright.
2. Hold the raised knee with your hands or by engaging your core to maintain the position.
3. Maintain the isometric hold, then lower the knee with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Stand tall, brace the core, and lift the knee without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Builds hamstring and glute strength and improves unilateral leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and the other leg extended straight.
2. Push through the heel of the bent leg and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Hold the top briefly and keep the extended leg aligned.
4. Lower your hips slowly to the floor and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis level and core braced as you lift

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk mobility and oblique activation for functional movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands on your hips.
2. Step one foot out to the side and bend the torso toward that side while keeping hips level.
3. Step back to center and repeat to the other side in a controlled waddle.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and move from the rib cage with control

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and segmental spinal control during rotational movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hands resting on the lower ribs.
2. Slide only your rib cage to one side while keeping your hips facing forward.
3. Return the ribs to center and repeat the slide to the opposite side.
Safety cue: Stabilize the pelvis and slide the rib cage smoothly without rotating the hips

Health benefit: Increases anterior lower leg flexibility and eases ankle dorsiflexion range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place one foot behind you with toes tucked under on the floor.
2. Shift your weight back onto the tucked toes and gently sink your hips toward your heels.
3. Hold briefly, lift the back foot, and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain a long spine and hinge from the hips without rounding the back

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and scapular coordination in a supported rotational pattern
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and extend the top arm toward the ceiling.
2. Rotate your torso and sweep the top arm in an arc toward the floor behind you while opening the chest.
3. Reverse the motion to return to the start and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked and move the top arm with control

Health benefit: Trains safe squat mechanics and builds lower body strength for daily sitting and standing
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in front of a chair with feet hip-width and arms extended forward.
2. Sit back onto the chair by bending your hips and knees until your glutes lightly touch the seat.
3. Drive through your heels to stand tall and repeat.
Safety cue: Push hips back, keep chest up and sit lightly onto the chair

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular activity and coordination with low impact lower body movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Step one foot out to the side while raising both arms overhead.
3. Step the foot back together while lowering the arms and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Step deliberately with a neutral spine and steady breathing

Health benefit: Promotes latissimus flexibility and improves shoulder girdle reach and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step back and hinge at the hips while keeping your arms straight to feel the stretch along the sides of your torso.
3. Hold briefly, then step forward to release and repeat as needed.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and reach through the arm while maintaining a neutral pelvis

Health benefit: Challenges proprioception and vestibular integration to improve balance under dynamic conditions
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift one foot slightly off the ground to balance on the other leg.
2. Keep your hips level and arms relaxed at your sides.
3. Slowly turn your head to the left and then to the right while maintaining balance.
4. Lower the foot and switch legs after completing the desired turns.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, soften the standing knee and turn your head slowly

Health benefit: Enhances glute and hip stability while engaging the core
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width apart on the floor.
2. Drive your hips up until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Lift one knee toward your chest while keeping hips level.
4. Lower that foot and repeat on the other side in a controlled march.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you alternately lift each knee

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and cardiovascular fitness without high joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Step sideways to the right and cross your left foot behind while lowering into a shallow lunge.
3. Push off the right foot to return to center and step to the left in the same pattern.
4. Continue alternating in a controlled, low-impact rhythm.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and hips back to control lateral motion

Health benefit: Increases anterior shoulder and chest mobility to support better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorframe and place your forearm on the frame with elbow at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest through the frame until you feel a stretch under the collarbone.
3. Hold the stretch, then step back and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep ribcage down and shoulders relaxed while leaning into the doorframe stretch

Health benefit: Challenges balance and proprioception to enhance stability in single limb tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the toe.
2. Close your eyes and engage your core to maintain an upright posture.
3. Hold the position for the desired time, then switch the lead foot.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall spine and soft knees while breathing steadily with eyes closed

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic mobility and scapular control for improved upper back movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and arms at your sides.
2. Press your lower back and arms into the floor and raise your arms overhead while keeping contact.
3. Slowly return your arms to your sides like making a snow angel while maintaining contact.
4. Repeat the motion with slow, controlled movements.
Safety cue: Press the lower back gently to the floor and move the shoulders slowly and deliberately

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain muscles while improving shoulder and core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands placed slightly behind your hips with fingers pointing toward your feet.
2. Press into your hands and heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Squeeze your glutes and open your chest while holding the position.
4. Lower your hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted in line with shoulders and engage glutes to prevent sagging

Health benefit: Encourages lumbar mobility and core coordination during controlled lower limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Lift one knee toward your chest while keeping your pelvis stable.
3. Lower that foot back to the floor and repeat on the other side in a controlled alternating pattern.
Safety cue: Stabilize the pelvis with the core and control each knee motion without jerking

Health benefit: Stretches lateral torso and hip muscles while promoting relaxation and spinal lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on hands and knees and sit back onto your heels while reaching your arms forward into child's pose.
2. Walk your right hand under your left arm and reach toward the left side, keeping your hips back.
3. Hold the side reach, then return both hands forward.
4. Repeat the sequence to the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops single leg stability and dynamic reach control for improved balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg slightly behind and both arms extended out to the sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach both arms forward while lifting the back leg into an anterior reach.
3. Keep your hips square and maintain balance on the standing leg.
4. Return to standing and switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and hinge from the hips while reaching forward with control

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and spinal mobility for better upper body movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on your hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Place one hand behind your head and rotate your thoracic spine to lift the elbow toward the ceiling.
3. Rotate the elbow back down toward the supporting hand and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stable and rotate through the upper back slowly while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes facing forward.
2. Lower into a shallow squat and keep chest upright.
3. Step laterally with one foot, then bring the other foot to meet it while maintaining the squat.
4. Continue stepping side to side with controlled, steady movements.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and weight in the heels as you step

Health benefit: Enhances upper body coordination and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a staggered boxing stance with hands up.
2. Drop your rear shoulder and drive a short uppercut from the hip toward chin level.
3. Return the hand to guard and immediately alternate to the other side.
Safety cue: Rotate through the hips and keep elbows tight to maintain control

Health benefit: Increases lateral spinal mobility and side body flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms lifted overhead.
2. Exhale and lean to one side from the waist while reaching the top arm over your head.
3. Inhale and return to center, then repeat to the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep a long spine and engage the core to avoid lower back collapse

Health benefit: Develops posterior chain strength and single leg balance through hip hinge
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a soft knee and hands by your sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach your hands toward the floor as you extend the other leg straight back.
3. Pause when your torso is nearly parallel to the floor while keeping a neutral spine.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one side facing a wall and feet hip-width apart.
2. Place the nearest hand on the wall at shoulder height.
3. Rotate your torso away while lifting the opposite arm overhead and tracing an arc.
4. Return the hand to the wall and repeat the arc motion.
Safety cue: Keep the moving arm long and rotate from the upper back while keeping hips stacked

Health benefit: Builds scapular control and supports improved shoulder alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet a few inches away.
2. Place forearms or hands on the wall at shoulder height.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and hold the contraction.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Elevates cardiovascular activation and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms by your sides.
2. Jump feet out wide while raising your arms overhead and tapping heels outward.
3. Jump feet back together and lower your arms to the sides.
Safety cue: Land softly on the balls of your feet and absorb impact with bent knees

Health benefit: Opens the chest and counteracts forward shoulder posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and knees at 90 degrees.
2. Clasp your hands behind your back and straighten your arms.
3. Lift your chest and draw your shoulder blades together while keeping the chin neutral.
Safety cue: Sit tall with ribs down and draw shoulder blades together to open the chest

Health benefit: Enhances ribcage mobility and rotational thoracic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and the top hand behind your head.
2. Reach the bottom hand toward the top ribs to establish a light grip.
3. Use the top elbow and torso to rotate the chest upward while guiding with the grip.
4. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate from the thoracic spine while exhaling to control the movement

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor activation and coordination during gait
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands on hips.
2. Step the right foot diagonally forward and outward into a V shape.
3. Bring the right foot back and immediately step the left foot diagonally forward.
4. Maintain an upright posture and march continuously at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and step with controlled cadence

Health benefit: Increases hip extension range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with one knee on the floor and the other foot planted in front at 90 degrees.
2. Tuck your pelvis slightly and keep your torso upright.
3. Shift your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the kneeling hip.
4. Hold the position while keeping your core engaged.
Safety cue: Tuck the pelvis and maintain an upright torso during the stretch

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and calf muscle strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the other foot lifted and hands on hips for balance.
2. Raise your heel to come onto the ball of the supporting foot.
3. Lower the heel back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee slightly bent and rise with ankle control

Health benefit: Strengthens thoracic extensors and promotes upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and hands lightly resting on the back of your neck.
2. Keep your elbows wide and chest lifted.
3. Gently extend backward from the upper spine while keeping your hips stable.
4. Return to upright position with control.
Safety cue: Hinge from the thoracic spine with core engaged and avoid lower back collapse

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordinated limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hips and knees bent at 90 degrees and arms pointing toward the ceiling.
2. Lower the right arm overhead while extending the left leg toward the floor.
3. Keep your lower back pressed gently into the mat and maintain core tension.
4. Return to center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Press the low back into the floor and move slowly with controlled breathing

Health benefit: Improves rotational power and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands in fists at chest level.
2. Rotate your torso and extend one arm diagonally across your body in a punch.
3. Retract the hand and repeat on the opposite side with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Rotate through the torso while keeping hips stable and shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and posterior shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and imagine a clock behind you.
2. Reach one arm back and across toward the 5 o'clock position while rotating your torso.
3. Return the arm to neutral and then reach the opposite arm toward the 7 o'clock position.
4. Maintain an upright posture and move with controlled motions.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a neutral spine and reach posteriorly with control

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and coordinated full body movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Reach both arms overhead and lengthen through the spine.
3. Hinge at the hips and roll down vertebra by vertebra toward the floor.
4. Reverse the movement by rolling up slowly to a tall standing position.
Safety cue: Articulate the spine sequentially from chest to hips while maintaining soft knees

Health benefit: Enhances full body core stability and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders.
2. Lift knees a few inches off the floor and keep hips level.
3. Hold a neutral spine and steady breathing.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and spine neutral while bracing the core

Health benefit: Improves hamstring activation and hip mobility during dynamic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and knees soft.
2. Jog in place and kick heels toward the glutes with each step.
3. Keep chest upright and drive arms in rhythm.
4. Land softly on the balls of your feet.
Safety cue: Drive heels toward glutes with an upright chest and soft knees

Health benefit: Develops hip flexor control and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a sturdy support and place one hand on it.
2. Swing the free leg forward in a controlled arc with a straight knee.
3. Keep the torso tall and hips square.
4. Repeat and switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Sit hips back toward the heels while keeping hands planted.
3. Rock hips forward over the knees to return to start.
4. Repeat the rocking motion smoothly.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move from the hips with steady breathing

Health benefit: Builds lateral core strength and shoulder stability with reduced load
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop up on the forearm with elbow under shoulder.
2. Bend the bottom knee and stack the top leg over it or keep it slightly forward.
3. Lift hips until body forms a straight line from shoulder to knee.
4. Hold the position and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Stack the shoulder over the forearm and keep hips lifted in a straight line

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and low impact cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and engage the core.
2. Drive one knee up while hopping lightly on the opposite foot.
3. Plant the forefoot and push off to alternate legs.
4. Maintain a quick rhythm and use arm drive.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and eases upper back muscle tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a bench or chair and place both palms on it at shoulder height.
2. Step back and hinge at the hips, lowering your chest toward your thighs.
3. Press the palms into the bench and lengthen the spine.
Safety cue: Sit tall, draw the shoulder blades down, and breathe into the chest

Health benefit: Enhances lateral strength and balance through controlled single leg loading
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and step wide to the side into a lateral lunge.
2. Bend the stepping knee and push hips back while keeping the other leg straight.
3. Drive through the planted foot to return to standing.
4. Lift the rear foot and balance on one leg before repeating on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and coordination through smooth circular movements
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and arms extended in front at chest height.
2. Move both arms together in a controlled horizontal figure-8 pattern.
3. Keep shoulders relaxed and repeat in the opposite direction.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and move the arms through a controlled full range of motion

Health benefit: Builds core endurance while minimizing lumbar strain
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent, the other leg straight, and hands under your lower back.
2. Tuck your chin and lift your head and chest a few inches while keeping the spine neutral.
3. Hold the position with steady breathing.
4. Lower slowly and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Brace the core and keep a neutral spine as you lift from the chest

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and reduces shoulder tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms extended at chest height, elbows wide.
2. Bring your palms together quickly and clap.
3. Open your arms back to the start position.
4. Repeat rhythmically while keeping shoulders relaxed.
Safety cue: Retract the shoulder blades and keep the chest lifted during the claps

Health benefit: Enhances spinal flexibility and gently stretches posterior chain
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees soft, hands resting on thighs or relaxed.
2. Tuck your chin and hinge forward from the hips.
3. Roll down vertebra by vertebra until arms hang or reach shins.
4. Roll back up slowly to standing with the chest leading.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and roll down vertebra by vertebra with soft knees

Health benefit: Promotes hip mobility and coordination through controlled leg movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with both knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Hug one knee toward your chest while keeping the other foot on the floor.
3. Release and alternate knees in a slow marching pattern.
Safety cue: Engage the core and keep shoulders relaxed as you draw each knee to the chest

Health benefit: Increases joint mobility and encourages gentle momentum control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hold a stable surface for balance with one hand.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and swing the other leg forward in a controlled arc.
3. Swing the leg backward and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Control the swing with your core and avoid using momentum from the torso

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and adductors while improving hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned slightly outward.
2. Bend your knees and push your hips back to lower into a squat until thighs are parallel.
3. Keep your chest up and knees tracking over your toes.
4. Push through your heels to stand back up.
Safety cue: Keep knees tracking over toes and maintain an upright chest

Health benefit: Improves coordination and elevates heart rate with minimal joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands on hips and feet together.
2. Step one foot out to the side, then step the other foot out to widen your stance.
3. Step both feet back together and continue alternating in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Land softly with a slight bend in the knees to absorb impact

Health benefit: Increases shoulder range of motion and relieves posterior tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall and extend one arm across your chest at shoulder height.
2. Use the opposite hand to grasp the extended arm near the elbow.
3. Gently pull the arm closer to your chest and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep the shoulder down and avoid twisting the torso as you pull across

Health benefit: Builds rotator cuff strength and supports shoulder stability during activities
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your elbow bent at 90 degrees and upper arm against your side.
2. Place the back of your hand or forearm against a nearby wall.
3. Push outward into the wall without moving the elbow to contract the external rotators.
4. Hold the contraction for the desired time and then relax.
Safety cue: Keep the elbow tucked at your side and avoid shrugging the shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances glute activation and hip stability while challenging core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift hips into a bridge until your body forms a straight line.
3. Lift one knee toward your chest while keeping hips level.
4. Lower the foot back down and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Squeeze glutes and keep hips level as you alternate legs

Health benefit: Improves lateral mobility and coordination with low impact cardiovascular engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and a slight bend in the knees.
2. Step to the side and touch the opposite foot with your hand or toe.
3. Step back to center and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Keep a slight knee bend and lead each step with hips and chest facing forward

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and soft tissue flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Tilt your head toward one shoulder until you feel a gentle stretch.
3. Hold, return to center, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep the spine long and gently guide the head with the opposite hand

Health benefit: Challenges dynamic balance and gait stability through narrow base walking
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place one foot directly in front of the other heel to toe.
2. Step forward by placing the back foot heel to toe in front of the other foot.
3. Continue walking forward in a straight line with controlled steps.
4. Pause and repeat the sequence for the desired distance.
Safety cue: Place each foot heel to toe and control each step with steady posture

Health benefit: Improves core stability and coordination while minimizing spinal loading
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet lifted off the floor.
2. Cross your arms over your chest.
3. Extend one leg straight toward the floor while keeping your back neutral.
4. Return the leg to start and repeat with the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move limbs slowly without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Activates anterior lower leg muscles and supports controlled gait mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit with one heel on the floor and toes pointed up.
2. Press the heel down into the floor as if pushing the ground.
3. Release and repeat with the other heel.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and hinge slightly from the hips as you press the heel down

Health benefit: Increases hamstring and lower back flexibility and promotes relaxed breathing
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and spine tall.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach toward your toes with a long spine.
3. Hold the stretch and then inhale to return to sitting.
Safety cue: Lengthen the spine on the inhale and hinge from the hips as you fold

Health benefit: Develops single leg balance and ankle proprioception with wall assistance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and place one hand on the wall for support.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the other foot to rest on your ankle or shin.
3. Keep hips level and engage your core to maintain balance.
4. Lower the lifted foot and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves upper back mobility and encourages better thoracic posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand a few inches from a wall with your upper back touching it.
2. Place your hands behind your head and arch your upper back over the wall.
3. Return to a neutral position and repeat.
Safety cue: Open through the chest and extend the upper spine while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Enhances lateral hip strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands on your hips.
2. Step your right foot wide to the right and bend the right knee.
3. Push through the right heel to return to center.
4. Repeat the movement to the left with control.
Safety cue: Sit hips back and keep chest tall with knee aligned over the foot

Health benefit: Improves low impact cardiovascular fitness and hip flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift one knee to hip level while keeping your arms down.
3. Lower that foot and repeat on the other side in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and engage core while landing softly on each foot

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and promotes hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hands behind your head.
2. Hinge at the hips by pushing them back and keep a neutral spine.
3. Lower your torso until it is parallel to the floor or you feel a stretch.
4. Drive your hips forward to return to standing.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine and a soft knee bend

Health benefit: Enhances upper back muscle activation and scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and bend your elbows to 90 degrees.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and move the elbows slightly backward.
3. Hold the squeeze briefly and then release with control.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together without shrugging and keep the neck long

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and balance for functional mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a stable step and place your hands on your hips.
2. Step up with one foot and press through the heel to lift your body.
3. Bring the trailing foot up to meet the lead foot on the step.
4. Step down with the same lead foot and repeat without swinging your arms.
Safety cue: Drive through the heel and keep torso upright while controlling the descent

Health benefit: Enhances quadriceps flexibility and knee range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one foot.
2. Bend the opposite knee and grab the ankle behind you.
3. Pull the ankle toward your glute and keep your knees close together.
Safety cue: Stand tall and pull heel toward glute with knee pointing down and hips square

Health benefit: Challenges core stability and dynamic balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, feet flat, and hands by your sides.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet a few inches off the floor to balance.
3. Rock your torso back toward your tailbone and then forward to an upright position.
4. Maintain a steady rhythm and control the movement.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral, brace your core, and rock slowly from the hips

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Slowly rotate your head to the right until you feel a gentle stretch.
3. Return to center and repeat the rotation to the left in a controlled manner.
Safety cue: Rotate slowly within a comfortable range and keep the shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Builds isometric strength in quadriceps and improves lower body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width apart.
2. Slide down until your knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Cross your arms over your chest.
4. Hold the position and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and press weight into heels with knees tracking over ankles
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Obesity / Overweight, Osteoarthritis

Health benefit: Improves chest mobility and posture through gentle anterior shoulder stretch
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a corner and place forearms on each wall at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest toward the corner.
3. Draw your shoulder blades down and back.
4. Hold the stretch and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Draw shoulder blades down and together while keeping the chest open and breathing steadily

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other on an imaginary line.
2. Soften your knees and extend your arms out to the sides.
3. Focus forward and hold a steady balance.
Safety cue: Center weight over the standing foot with a soft knee and upright torso

Health benefit: Improves shoulder girdle control and neck muscle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms at your sides.
2. Lift your shoulders toward your ears in a controlled shrug.
3. Slowly press your shoulders down away from your ears.
4. Repeat the lift and controlled lowering for desired reps.
Safety cue: Pull your shoulders down away from your ears while maintaining a long neck

Health benefit: Improves lateral movement speed and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Keep your arms low at your sides and sink into a quarter squat.
3. Shuffle laterally several quick, controlled steps in one direction.
4. Reverse direction and maintain the low arm position.
Safety cue: Stay low with hips back and chest up while shuffling with controlled quick steps

Health benefit: Increases hip external rotation flexibility and reduces muscle tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with both feet flat on the floor.
2. Cross one ankle over the opposite knee and keep your spine straight.
3. Lean forward from the hips until you feel a stretch and hold.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor endurance and core stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift one knee toward your chest to hip height.
2. Hold the lifted knee with your hands or keep your arms by your sides for balance.
3. Maintain an upright posture and breathe while holding.
Safety cue: Keep the pelvis level and core engaged to prevent leaning or rotating the torso

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves spinal extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands resting at your hips and legs extended.
2. Press your hips into the ground and lift your chest off the floor.
3. Keep your neck neutral and squeeze your upper back as you lift.
4. Hold the lifted position and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and improves ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart with weight evenly distributed.
2. Rise up onto the balls of both feet until heels lift.
3. Lower heels slowly back to the floor.
Safety cue: Press evenly through both feet and keep a tall spine

Health benefit: Improves quickness and foot coordination with low impact cardiovascular engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a slight squat with knees soft and weight centered.
2. Quickly lift and tap one foot, then the other in small alternating steps.
3. Maintain a low range of motion and quick, controlled taps.
Safety cue: Stay light on your toes and keep a soft knee bend

Health benefit: Gently stretches lower back and gluteal muscles while promoting relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and arms by your sides.
2. Draw one knee toward your chest and wrap both hands around the shin.
3. Hold briefly then lower the leg back down and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep lower back grounded and draw knees toward chest with control

Health benefit: Improves single-leg balance and posterior chain strength with support
Steps to perform:
1. Stand next to a stable support and place one hand on it.
2. Hinge at the hips while lifting the free leg straight back and keeping the standing knee soft.
3. Lower the torso until you feel a stretch in the standing leg then pause.
4. Drive the hips forward and return to standing.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine and tap support lightly for balance

Health benefit: Builds shoulder internal rotator endurance and improves neuromuscular control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand side-on to a wall with elbow bent at 90 degrees.
2. Press the inner forearm into the wall without moving the shoulder joint.
3. Hold the gentle inward pressure while keeping the rest of the arm still.
Safety cue: Anchor the elbow at your side and press inward without letting the shoulder lift

Health benefit: Increases lower body muscular endurance and maintains squat position stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Lower into a shallow squat until thighs are engaged.
3. Pulse up a few inches and then drop back into the squat repeatedly.
4. Keep weight on the heels and knees tracking over toes.
Safety cue: Keep knees tracking over toes and pulse from the hips without collapsing the chest

Health benefit: Increases lateral neck flexibility and reduces muscle tension around the neck
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Tilt the right ear toward the right shoulder without lifting the shoulder.
3. Return to center and repeat the tilt to the left.
4. Keep movements slow and avoid forcing the neck.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and gently tilt from the neck without rotating the torso

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg balance and improves core and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall on one leg with the other foot resting on the inner calf or ankle.
2. Bring hands to chest or press palms together in front of the sternum.
3. Find balance and hold the position with steady breathing.
Safety cue: Root the standing foot and engage the core to keep the hips level

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal muscles and supports trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat and place fingertips behind your head for neck support.
2. Exhale and curl your shoulders and upper chest off the floor using your abdominal muscles.
3. Hold the lifted position briefly while keeping the neck supported by your hands.
4. Inhale and slowly lower the shoulders back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Tuck chin slightly and lift using the core rather than pulling with the neck

Health benefit: Increases lower body muscular endurance and quadriceps activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width apart a short distance from the wall.
2. Slide down the wall until your knees are bent and thighs are roughly parallel to the floor.
3. Hold the position for the desired time and then press through your feet to slide back up the wall.
Safety cue: Press your low back into the wall and keep knees aligned over ankles

Health benefit: Promotes light cardiovascular activity and improves gait rhythm
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms relaxed and hanging at your sides.
2. Lift one knee toward hip level while keeping the opposite foot planted and arms down.
3. Alternate knees in a steady rhythm and continue marching in place.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright spine and lift knees with slow, controlled marches

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back muscles and improves posture alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands resting on your thighs.
2. Pull your shoulder blades back and down as if trying to pinch them together.
3. Hold briefly, then relax the shoulders and repeat.
Safety cue: Retract and depress the shoulder blades while keeping the chest open

Health benefit: Increases lateral neck flexibility and eases muscle tension
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and chin level.
2. Tilt your head slowly toward one shoulder until you feel a gentle stretch on the opposite side.
3. Hold the stretch briefly, then return the head to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep the chin level and bend the neck slowly within a comfortable range

Health benefit: Challenges static balance and improves proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright and place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
2. Keep your eyes open and focus on a fixed point ahead while maintaining balance.
3. Hold the position for the desired time, then step back to a normal stance.
Safety cue: Place feet heel-to-toe and maintain an upright posture over the midline

Health benefit: Engages chest and shoulder stabilizers while promoting upper body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your palms against the wall at a low height near the abdomen.
2. Press your hands into the wall without letting your body move toward the wall.
3. Hold the pressing tension for several seconds while breathing steadily.
4. Release the pressure and relax your arms before repeating.
Safety cue: Brace the core and press evenly through the palms without shrugging shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances lateral lower body coordination and light calorie expenditure
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands on hips.
2. Step right with your right foot and shift weight onto it.
3. Bring your left foot back to meet the right and tap lightly.
4. Repeat the movement to the left side.
Safety cue: Keep knees slightly bent and land softly through the midfoot

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and posture awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift both shoulders toward your ears.
3. Roll your shoulders backward in a smooth circle.
4. Repeat the backward rolls at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Roll shoulders slowly with scapular control and avoid shrugging

Health benefit: Increases chest and anterior shoulder flexibility for better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway facing forward.
2. Place your forearms low on the door frame with elbows bent.
3. Step one foot forward until you feel a stretch across the lower chest.
4. Hold the position for the desired time.
Safety cue: Keep a long spine and gently retract the shoulder blades to target the chest

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and promotes hip extension activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement.
4. Lower your hips slowly back to the floor.
Safety cue: Drive through the heels and maintain a neutral pelvis without overextending the lower back

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Tilt your pelvis and arch your back slightly on the inhale.
3. Round your spine gently on the exhale with a small range of motion.
4. Continue alternating the small arch and round movements.
Safety cue: Move with the breath and control each small spinal segment through the range

Health benefit: Enhances core coordination and lower trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms resting on the floor and knees bent.
2. Press your lower back into the floor and extend one leg slowly.
3. Return the extended leg to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement with the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves balance and lateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place one foot directly in front of the other.
2. Step forward heel-to-toe with small, controlled steps.
3. Keep arms out to the sides for balance and continue walking forward.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and take slow narrow steps with an upright posture

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and promotes scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms resting alongside your body and palms down.
2. Lift your chest and head slightly while squeezing the shoulder blades down and together.
3. Keep the pelvis pressed into the floor and hold the position.
4. Lower your chest and head slowly back to the start.
Safety cue: Squeeze the shoulder blades and lift the chest while avoiding excess lower back arch

Health benefit: Helps improve pelvic control and lower back mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Tuck the pelvis under to flatten the lower back and engage your core.
3. Release to a neutral spine and feel a gentle arch.
4. Repeat the tilt with controlled breathing.
Safety cue: Tuck the tailbone and flatten the lower back while keeping ribs relaxed

Health benefit: Teaches safe sit to stand mechanics and leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and a chair behind you.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the knees as you lower toward the chair.
3. Lightly tap the chair with your glutes without fully sitting down.
4. Push through your heels to stand back up.
Safety cue: Sit back into the chair by pushing hips back and keep knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Improves wrist mobility and joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Extend both arms in front at shoulder height with palms down.
2. Rotate both wrists together in controlled clockwise circles.
3. Reverse direction and perform controlled counterclockwise circles.
Safety cue: Circle wrists slowly with controlled motion and soft elbows

Health benefit: Increases calf muscle flexibility and ankle range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Face a wall and place hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back with the heel down and the back leg straight.
3. Bend the front knee and press hips forward until the calf feels stretched.
4. Return to start and switch legs.
Safety cue: Press the back heel down and keep the spine long

Health benefit: Raises heart rate gently and strengthens hip flexors
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands on hips or at your sides.
2. Lift one knee toward hip height in a controlled motion.
3. Lower that foot and alternate with the other knee at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Lift knees with control, keep hips level and avoid leaning back

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and spinal rotation range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands behind your head.
2. Rotate your upper torso to one side while keeping hips facing forward.
3. Return to center with control.
4. Repeat the rotation to the opposite side.
Safety cue: Rotate from the upper spine with hips grounded and spine tall

Health benefit: Stretches the back and shoulders while encouraging gentle relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels.
2. Reach both arms back alongside your hips with palms facing up.
3. Rest your forehead toward the mat and breathe while holding the position.
Safety cue: Sink hips toward your heels while lengthening the spine and breathing deeply

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a stable surface and lightly hold it for support.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the other foot off the ground, bending the knee.
3. Keep hips level and engage your core to maintain balance.
4. Lower the lifted foot and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Stand tall, engage your core, and keep the supporting knee slightly soft

Health benefit: Improves lateral movement control and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Lower hips into a small athletic stance and keep chest up.
3. Push off with the outside foot and take a slow lateral step.
4. Continue shuffling slowly, then change direction when ready.
Safety cue: Keep chest up, hips level, and take controlled lateral steps

Health benefit: Increases lateral trunk flexibility and side body mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms resting at your sides.
2. Keep hips facing forward and bend slowly to one side from the waist.
3. Reach the hand toward the knee while keeping the opposite side long.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core engaged as you hinge laterally

Health benefit: Enhances glute activation and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Keep hips square and extend one leg straight back until inline with the body.
3. Hold the position briefly with core engaged.
4. Lower the leg and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain a level pelvis and extend the leg slowly without rotating the torso

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and improves ankle plantarflexion strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Rise up onto the balls of your feet by lifting your heels.
3. Lower your heels back down under control.
Safety cue: Rise through the balls of your feet with knees soft and control the descent

Health benefit: Improves hip joint mobility and movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Rotate your hips in a smooth circular motion.
3. Reverse the circle and repeat in the opposite direction.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and move the hips smoothly without forcing the range

Health benefit: Increases groin flexibility and inner thigh range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with the soles of your feet together and knees dropped outward.
2. Hold your feet and gently press your knees toward the floor.
3. Maintain an upright chest and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral spine and hinge from the hips to lean forward gently

Health benefit: Improves deep core activation and spinal support awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Exhale and draw your lower abdomen inward toward your spine.
3. Hold the contraction for several breaths without moving your pelvis.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral coordination and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands on hips.
2. Step your right foot directly to the right side.
3. Cross your left foot behind the right foot and shift weight.
4. Step the right foot to the right and cross the left foot in front to return.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core engaged throughout the pattern

Health benefit: Challenges core stability and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the floor to balance on your sit bones.
3. Rock backward and forward using your core to control the movement.
Safety cue: Brace your core and move slowly to maintain balance

Health benefit: Builds external rotator strength to enhance shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with the side of your upper arm near a wall and elbow bent to 90 degrees.
2. Place the back of your hand against the wall at elbow level.
3. Push the back of your hand into the wall without moving the shoulder.
4. Hold the isometric contraction and then relax.
Safety cue: Keep your elbow pinned to your side and rotate from the shoulder with control

Health benefit: Builds core endurance while reducing joint stress compared with standard plank
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders.
2. Walk feet back until body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Hold the alignment while keeping core engaged.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to knees and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Increases lower body circulation and gently raises heart rate
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift one knee to hip level while keeping arms down.
3. Lower and repeat with the opposite knee in a steady march.
Safety cue: Stand tall, engage your core, and lift each knee with control

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and promotes balance through wider base stepping
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms fixed at your sides or on your hips.
2. Step your right foot outward and lift the left knee toward hip level.
3. Return and repeat on the opposite side in a wide marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep your chest up and hips level while stepping wide with deliberate control

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and builds lower body muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Bend your knees slightly and shuffle quickly to the right with small steps.
3. Shuffle back to the left while maintaining the knee bend and hand position.
Safety cue: Stay low with hips back, chest forward, and shuffle with quick controlled steps

Health benefit: Improves knee joint mobility and increases blood circulation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and weight evenly distributed.
2. Lift one knee to hip height and tap with the opposite hand.
3. Lower the foot and repeat on the other side.
4. Continue alternating at a steady, controlled pace.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral as you lift each knee

Health benefit: Enhances hamstring activation and elevates heart rate moderately
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and begin walking forward with small steps.
2. Bend one knee and bring the heel toward the glutes.
3. Place the foot down and step forward with the other leg.
4. Keep a steady walking rhythm and alternate heels.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and land softly on each stride

Health benefit: Increases hip mobility and promotes gentle joint lubrication
Steps to perform:
1. Stand holding a stable support with one hand and shift weight onto the supporting leg.
2. Let the free leg swing forward and backward like a pendulum with a relaxed knee.
3. Control the motion and repeat for the desired number of swings.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and control the swing without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and relieves muscular stiffness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Gently drop the chin and rotate the head slowly in a full circle.
3. Reverse direction after a few rotations while keeping the movement smooth.
Safety cue: Rotate slowly with a slight chin tuck and avoid forcing the range

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic spine mobility and rotational range
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and stack shoulders and hips.
2. Extend the top arm forward and keep the lower arm under your head for support.
3. Rotate the top arm and chest toward the ceiling while opening the thoracic spine.
4. Return the arm across the body and repeat before switching sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and initiate rotation from the upper back not the lower spine

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and joint awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or lie and lift one foot off the ground.
2. Rotate the ankle slowly clockwise in a full circle.
3. Reverse the direction and rotate counterclockwise.
Safety cue: Rotate the foot slowly from the ankle with controlled motion and keep the shin stable

Health benefit: Promotes posterior shoulder flexibility and improves range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Bring one arm across your chest at shoulder height.
2. Use the opposite hand to press the arm closer to your chest near the elbow.
3. Hold the stretch, then release and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Stretches the back and shoulders while promoting relaxation and breathing control
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the floor and sit back on your heels.
2. Slide your arms back alongside your hips with palms facing down.
3. Lower your chest toward your thighs and rest your forehead on the floor.
4. Hold the position, then walk your hands forward to rise.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips, reach the arms back, and lengthen the spine while breathing smoothly

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps flexibility and supports balanced lower limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place one hand on a wall or chair for balance.
2. Bend your right knee and grab your right ankle with your right hand.
3. Pull your heel toward your glutes while keeping knees close together and hips neutral.
4. Hold briefly, release, and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases calf flexibility and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with hands at shoulder height.
2. Place one foot forward and one foot back with the back heel down.
3. Bend the front knee and press hips forward until you feel the stretch in the back calf.
4. Hold the stretch, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep back heel down and spine long

Health benefit: Improves forearm flexibility and wrist mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm in front with palm facing up and elbow straight.
2. Use the opposite hand to gently bend the fingers and wrist downward toward the floor.
3. Keep the arm straight and hold the stretch in the forearm.
Safety cue: Extend arm and gently pull fingers back while keeping wrist aligned with forearm

Health benefit: Builds single leg stability and hip strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one leg.
2. Place the sole of the other foot on the ankle or lower calf, avoiding the knee.
3. Bring your hands to your chest or raise them slightly for balance.
4. Press the foot into the leg and hold, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Root standing foot, place sole on inner calf not the knee, and square the hips

Health benefit: Enhances ankle mobility and forward weight transfer coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands lightly on hips.
2. Shift weight back onto your heels lifting your toes, then shift forward onto your toes lifting your heels.
3. Repeat controlled heel-to-toe rocking while keeping knees soft.
Safety cue: Rock smoothly from heel to toe keeping weight centered over the midfoot and spine neutral

Health benefit: Develops dynamic single leg control and reach awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall on one leg with a slight bend in the knee.
2. Lift the free leg a few inches and point it toward a clock position.
3. Reach the leg slowly to each chosen position while keeping hips level.
4. Return to center between reaches and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep your chest lifted and control the leg movement from the hip

Health benefit: Builds quadriceps endurance and lower body muscular stamina
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against the wall and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Slide down until your knees form about a 90-degree angle.
3. Keep weight in your heels and core braced.
4. Push through your feet to slide back up to standing.
Safety cue: Drive through your heels and press your lower back into the wall

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor mobility and controlled cardiovascular effort
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and begin a slow march in place.
2. Lift one knee slowly toward hip height with control.
3. Lower that knee and alternate slowly while maintaining an upright posture.
Safety cue: Land softly and maintain upright posture with your core engaged

Health benefit: Increases lateral neck mobility and muscular awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Tilt your head slowly to bring your ear toward your shoulder.
3. Hold briefly and return to center, then repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Move slowly with relaxed shoulders while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Refines balance and postural control in narrow base of support
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the toe.
2. Cross your arms over your chest and keep your gaze forward.
3. Hold steady to challenge balance, then switch the leading foot.
Safety cue: Stack hips over shoulders and breathe steadily to stay balanced

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall, feet hip-width, arms crossed over chest.
2. Step right with your right foot, pushing off the left foot.
3. Bring the left foot toward the right foot to return to base.
4. Repeat to the left, keeping arms crossed and controlled.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you step laterally

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hands on hips.
2. Push your hips forward then rotate them in a slow circular motion clockwise.
3. Reverse the direction and perform slow circular hip rotations counterclockwise.
Safety cue: Control the circular motion from the hips and keep the spine neutral

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the opposite foot a few inches off the floor.
3. Keep hips level, hold the position, then lower the lifted foot and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee soft and hips level while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and hamstrings while promoting pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width on the floor.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top.
4. Lower your hips slowly back to the floor.
Safety cue: Press through the heels, lift with the glutes and avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and eases posterior leg tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with one leg extended and the other foot against the inner thigh.
2. Keep your back long and hinge forward from the hips toward the extended leg.
3. Reach toward the toes while maintaining a straight spine.
4. Hold briefly, sit back up, and switch legs.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a long spine and breathe into the stretch

Health benefit: Develops core control and improves coordinated limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent at 90 degrees and arms crossed over your chest.
2. Press your lower back into the floor and extend your right leg slowly toward the floor.
3. Bring your right leg back to the starting position.
4. Repeat the same extension with the left leg while keeping your arms crossed.
Safety cue: Keep the lower back pressed to the floor and move limbs slowly with controlled breaths

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and gentle lower leg activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and one foot slightly in front.
2. Extend the front heel forward with toes lifted and dig the heel into the floor.
3. Shift weight back to both feet and alternate heels in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine tall while controlling each heel dig

Health benefit: Strengthens upper trapezius and relieves neck tension
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand upright with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift both shoulders straight up toward your ears in a smooth motion.
3. Lower shoulders back down and repeat with controlled breaths.
Safety cue: Lift and lower shoulders with slow control while keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Increases wrist flexibility and reduces forearm muscle tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm forward at shoulder height with palm facing down.
2. Use the opposite hand to gently press the fingers and hand down toward you.
3. Hold the stretch then release and switch arms.
Safety cue: Extend the arm and gently pull back the fingers to create a controlled stretch

Health benefit: Improves balance and lower limb coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place feet heel-to-toe as if on a line with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Keep arms down and steady while engaging your core and looking forward.
3. Take small controlled steps along the line, placing heel in front of toe.
4. Pause to regain balance as needed and continue slowly.
Safety cue: Take slow controlled steps with hips level and a steady gaze
is_not_suitable_for: Sarcopenia, Depression / Anxiety, Cognitive Decline / Dementia

Health benefit: Enhances spinal extension capacity and posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and hands resting by your hips.
2. Press your hands lightly into the floor and lift your chest while keeping hips on the mat.
3. Lower your chest back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Lift the chest using controlled spinal extension while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a chair and place forearms on the seat with elbows under shoulders.
2. Round your back and tuck your chin to draw your spine into a cat curve.
3. Arch your back and lift your chest while looking slightly forward to create a cow curve.
4. Alternate between the two positions in a slow, controlled flow.
Safety cue: Move through flexion and extension slowly while keeping forearms steady on the chair

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps flexibility and knee joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and bend one knee, reaching the same-side hand back to grasp the ankle.
2. Pull the ankle gently toward your glute while keeping knees close and hips level.
3. Hold the stretch then release and switch sides.
Safety cue: Stand tall, keep knees aligned, and pull the heel toward the glute with control

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg while placing the sole of the other foot on the inner calf or thigh.
2. Bring hands together at your heart and press palms gently together.
3. Find balance and hold the pose, then lower the foot and switch sides.
Safety cue: Balance on one foot with hips level and core engaged

Health benefit: Enhances lateral coordination and lower body balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands on hips.
2. Step diagonally right creating a wide V with your legs.
3. Push through the right foot to return to center.
4. Repeat the step to the left side.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and hips level as you step

Health benefit: Enhances balance and gait stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms relaxed.
2. Rock back onto your heels and lift your toes.
3. Rock forward onto your toes and lift your heels.
Safety cue: Rock slowly and keep weight centered over the foot

Health benefit: Boosts hip flexor strength and walking mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place hands on your waist.
2. Lift one knee toward your chest keeping your torso upright.
3. Lower the foot back down and perform the lift with the other leg.
Safety cue: Engage your core and lift the knee with controlled motion

Health benefit: Challenges single leg balance and proprioception control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one leg.
2. Bend the opposite knee and lift the heel toward your glute.
3. Hold your balance and lower the foot with control.
Safety cue: Stand tall with a soft supporting knee and focus on a fixed point

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side in a straight line with head supported.
2. Stack your legs and point your toes forward.
3. Lift the top leg slowly to about hip height without rotating the torso.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift the top leg with controlled movement

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and hip coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Bend knees slightly and lower into an athletic stance.
3. Shuffle to the right with quick, controlled steps while keeping hips level.
4. Reverse direction and shuffle to the left with the same controlled steps.
Safety cue: Keep hips low, chest lifted, and step with control

Health benefit: Increases lateral trunk flexibility and side body mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with one arm hanging by your side.
2. Slide the hanging arm down and bend the torso toward that side.
3. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and bend from the waist with a long spine

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and ankle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Rise onto the balls of both feet by lifting the heels.
3. Lower the heels back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Rise through the balls of the feet with ankles aligned and spine tall

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring mobility and light cardiovascular conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Walk forward at a steady pace with an upright posture.
2. Lift one heel toward the glutes so the foot approaches the backside.
3. Land softly on the forefoot and continue alternating heels to glutes.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and pull the heel toward the glute with controlled cadence

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and lower body agility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands on hips.
2. Step your right foot out to the right side.
3. Cross your left foot behind the right and step right again.
4. Bring the left foot to meet the right and reset your weight.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso and step with control keeping hips level

Health benefit: Increases neck extension range and supports head alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with a neutral spine.
2. Tilt your head backward and lift your chin toward the ceiling.
3. Hold the position briefly and return your head to neutral.
Safety cue: Keep the spine neutral and extend the neck slowly without forcing the movement

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and improves shoulder posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with elbows bent and hands near your shoulders in a W shape.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your forearms and chest off the floor.
3. Lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Squeeze the shoulder blades and lift with control while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and rhythmic coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift your right knee toward your chest while driving your opposite arm forward.
3. Lower the right foot and lift the left knee in the same controlled manner.
4. Maintain a slow, steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright posture and lift knees with controlled hip flexion and steady breathing

Health benefit: Promotes neck mobility and gentle muscular relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with your spine straight.
2. Drop your chin to your chest and slowly roll your head to the right shoulder.
3. Continue the roll to the back, then to the left shoulder, and return to the chest.
Safety cue: Move the neck slowly in a controlled circle while keeping the shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and releases upper back tension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall or sit upright.
2. Lift shoulders toward ears, then roll them back and down in a smooth circle.
3. Repeat several times, then reverse the direction.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and roll shoulders in slow controlled circles

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and promotes hip extension range
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with both legs extended.
2. Loop a strap or hold behind one thigh and lift that leg toward the ceiling.
3. Keep the lifted leg straight with a soft knee and feel the stretch in the hamstring.
4. Lower the leg with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep lower back grounded and hinge from the hip to stretch the hamstring

Health benefit: Strengthens glute muscles and supports hip extension during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top while keeping your core engaged.
4. Lower your hips with control back to the floor.
Safety cue: Drive through the heels and squeeze glutes at the top while keeping hips level

Health benefit: Improves core stability and coordination with controlled limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet lifted so shins are parallel to the floor.
2. Cross your arms over your chest and brace your core to flatten your lower back.
3. Slowly extend one leg toward the floor while keeping the other knee bent.
4. Return the extended leg to the start and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and joint lubrication
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands on hips.
2. Shift weight to one leg and lift the opposite knee.
3. Rotate the lifted leg in a slow circular motion from the hip.
4. Reverse the circle direction after a set of repetitions.
Safety cue: Brace your core and move the hips in slow controlled circles

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and postural stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other, heel touching toe.
2. Keep hips level and arms relaxed at your sides or extended for balance.
3. Hold the stance and focus on a steady gaze.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances balance and core engagement while promoting body awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Place the sole of the other foot against the inner calf or thigh.
3. Bring both palms to your heart center.
4. Hold the pose and keep your gaze steady.
Safety cue: Ground the standing foot, engage your core, and keep hips level with hands at heart

Health benefit: Boosts lateral coordination and lower body mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and hands on your hips.
2. Step the right foot diagonally outward to form half of a V.
3. Return the right foot to center.
4. Repeat the same step with the left foot to complete the V pattern.
Safety cue: Step in a controlled V pattern keeping hips level and hands on hips for stability

Health benefit: Enhances groin and inner thigh flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and bring the soles of your feet together.
2. Hold your feet and let your knees fall toward the floor.
3. Keep your back straight and lean forward slightly.
4. Hold the position and then release.
Safety cue: Sit tall and hinge from the hips while gently pressing knees toward the floor

Health benefit: Develops single-leg balance and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one foot.
2. Lift the opposite foot and place it against the inner calf or ankle.
3. Keep hips level and hands on hips or raised for balance.
Safety cue: Balance on one leg with a soft knee and hips level

Health benefit: Improves walking stability and lower limb coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a step forward placing heel first.
2. Roll through the foot to the toes and push off to bring the back foot forward.
3. Continue placing each foot heel-to-toe in a straight line.
Safety cue: Step heel to toe with eyes forward and core engaged

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and spinal extensor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms positioned slightly back at your sides.
2. Lift your chest, arms, and legs off the floor while keeping your neck neutral.
3. Squeeze your glutes and shoulder blades together.
4. Lower down with control.
Safety cue: Lift chest and legs using glutes while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Targets abdominal endurance and trunk flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and arms crossed over your chest.
2. Engage your core and lift your shoulders off the floor using your abs.
3. Lower your shoulders back down with control.
Safety cue: Exhale as you curl using your abs and keep the lower back grounded

Health benefit: Improves single-leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one foot.
2. Bend the opposite knee and lift the foot toward your glute.
3. Extend your arms for balance and hold.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee soft, hips level, and maintain a steady gaze for balance

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and dynamic balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on your sit bones with knees bent and feet lifted off the floor.
2. Extend your arms forward and lean back to balance in a boat position.
3. Rock backward so your shoulders lower toward the floor while maintaining core tension.
4. Rock forward to return to the balanced boat position and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and control the rocking motion from your core

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder and upper back muscles to support posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms at your sides and palms down.
2. Lift your chest and head off the floor while squeezing your shoulder blades down and together.
3. Hold the lifted position briefly and lower slowly back down.
Safety cue: Retract the shoulder blades to lift the chest and avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves lower body strength and functional stair climbing ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a stable step or bench and place one foot on the step.
2. Push through the heel of the planted foot to lift your body up onto the step.
3. Step back down with control and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and promotes spinal flexion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with legs extended and feet flexed.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach toward your toes.
3. Keep a long spine and avoid rounding excessively.
4. Hold, then slowly roll up to sit.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a long spine and lead the movement from your chest

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and lower limb coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one leg straight and the other knee bent.
2. Lift the straight leg to hip height and point the toes.
3. Reach the raised leg slowly toward selected clock positions with control.
4. Lower the leg and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout
