Health benefit: Strengthens deep neck flexors and promotes better head and neck alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Gently tuck your chin toward your chest by sliding the head back into the surface.
3. Hold briefly then relax and repeat with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Gently tuck your chin and lengthen the back of the neck without lifting the head

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular endurance and whole body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands at chest.
2. Step one foot out to the side while opening both arms out wide.
3. Step back to center and bring the arms back to the chest.
4. Repeat on the other side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Move with control and land softly while keeping your chest lifted and hips stable

Health benefit: Opens the chest and improves anterior shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place one forearm against the frame with elbow at shoulder height.
2. Step forward with the same-side foot until you feel a stretch in the front chest.
3. Hold briefly then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and encourages upright chest posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one foot.
2. Lift the other foot slightly off the ground and draw the shoulder blades together to open the chest.
3. Extend the arms out to the sides or clasp behind your back to increase chest opening.
4. Hold with steady breathing then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves coordination and encourages upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift one knee while reaching both arms forward.
3. Open arms wide and squeeze shoulder blades as you step down.
4. Alternate legs in a controlled marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep tall posture and squeeze shoulder blades as you lift each knee

Health benefit: Increases spinal mobility and encourages gentle movement awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Arch your back and lift your chest and tailbone.
3. Round your back and tuck your chin and tailbone.
4. Move slowly between positions with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Coordinate slow breaths with spinal flexion and extension, moving with control

Health benefit: Enhances balance and reinforces proper shoulder alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other heel-to-toe.
2. Roll shoulders back and down and lift your chest.
3. Maintain balance and switch the front foot as needed.
Safety cue: Stack hips and shoulders, lift the chest and keep shoulders down and back

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and strengthens posterior chain stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one hand on a support and hinge at the hips with the other arm extended forward.
2. Lean forward until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor while lifting the rear leg and keeping hips square.
3. Hold the position in a straight line from head to lifted heel and then return to standing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic spine mobility and rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and arms extended in front.
2. Reach the top arm toward the ceiling and place the palm by your ear.
3. Rotate the top arm open across your body while keeping hips stacked.
4. Return the arm to the start position and repeat slowly.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the thoracic spine

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and promotes thoracic extension awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Press your lower back and arms into the floor and start with arms at your sides.
3. Slide your arms overhead keeping contact with the floor as long as possible.
4. Reverse the motion to return to the start and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the lower back lightly on the floor and move arms slowly

Health benefit: Strengthens gluteal muscles and supports hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width apart.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top and avoid overextending your lower back.
4. Lower your hips back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Drive through your heels and lift by squeezing the glutes while keeping ribs down

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and light aerobic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step to the right with your right foot and bring your left foot to touch next to it.
3. Open your arms out wide as you step and keep a slight bend in your knees.
4. Repeat the motion to the left and continue alternating steps.
Safety cue: Step with control and maintain an upright posture with core engaged

Health benefit: Relieves neck tension and increases upper neck mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and rotate your head about 45 degrees toward one side.
2. Tilt your chin downward toward your chest slowly.
3. Place your hand on the back of your head and gently guide the movement for a deeper stretch.
4. Hold briefly then return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders relaxed and tuck the chin slightly to lengthen the side of the neck

Health benefit: Enhances balance and proprioception during gait
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and focus your gaze forward with your head up.
2. Step forward placing your heel on the ground first and then roll onto your toe.
3. Keep a straight line by placing each foot directly in front of the other.
4. Continue walking in this heel-to-toe pattern for the desired distance.
Safety cue: Keep head up, shoulders relaxed, and take controlled heel-to-toe steps

Health benefit: Improves scapular stability and shoulder posture control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and down without shrugging.
3. Hold the contraction for the desired time then relax.
Safety cue: Squeeze the shoulder blades together without shrugging and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Develops single leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand sideways near a wall and place one hand lightly on the wall for support.
2. Shift weight onto the standing foot and place the opposite foot on the inner calf or thigh, avoiding the knee.
3. Press the foot into the standing leg and lengthen through the spine.
4. Keep the other hand on the wall or lift it and hold your balance.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and lower back endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Simultaneously lift your arms, chest, and legs off the floor using your back and glutes.
3. Hold the elevated position with a neutral neck and then lower back down.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and latissimus flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on the wall at shoulder height or higher.
2. Walk your feet back and lower your hips while keeping your arms straight until you feel a stretch along the sides of your torso.
3. Hold the stretch with a long spine and then walk your feet forward to release.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down, reach through the arm and avoid shrugging the shoulder toward the ear

Health benefit: Engages posterior chain and improves core and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands placed slightly behind your hips with fingers pointing toward your feet.
2. Press through your hands and heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to heels.
3. Squeeze your glutes and lengthen through the spine while keeping shoulders down.
4. Lower your hips back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and low impact aerobic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Step your right foot out diagonally while raising both arms overhead.
3. Return feet together while lowering arms to your sides.
4. Repeat to the left and continue alternating at a controlled pace.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral while stepping with soft knees

Health benefit: Increases neck flexibility and relieves muscular tension
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Tilt your head to the right and rotate slightly to look up and over your right shoulder.
3. Place your right hand on the left side of your head and gently pull to increase the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders relaxed and gently guide your head without forcing the stretch

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a stable chair and place one hand lightly on the back for support.
2. Shift weight to the standing leg and hinge at the hips while lifting the other leg straight back.
3. Lower your torso until you feel a stretch in the standing hamstring while keeping a flat back.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves core activation and coordination between upper and lower body
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and raise both arms overhead.
2. Lift your right knee toward your chest while pulling your arms down toward your sides.
3. Lower the leg and arms to start and repeat on the opposite side with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Brace your core and exhale as you lift the knee while controlling the arm pull

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle trunk rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Place your right hand on the left knee and your left hand behind you for support.
3. Rotate your torso to the left using your hands to guide the twist and keep the spine long.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate from your thoracic spine while keeping both hips grounded

Health benefit: Builds core stability and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Tuck your toes and lift your knees a few inches off the floor to form a straight line from head to heels.
3. Keep your core braced and avoid sagging or piking of the hips.
4. Maintain alignment for the desired duration with steady control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral coordination and light cardiovascular conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and arms raised diagonally in a V.
2. Step your right foot toward the center while keeping arms lifted.
3. Return your right foot to the wide position and lower arms slightly.
4. Repeat the movement to the left side in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and step deliberately with arms wide for balance

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and thoracic rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand sideways to a wall and place one hand on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Rotate your torso and sweep the opposite arm up and overhead in a controlled arc.
3. Reverse the motion to return to start and repeat for the other side.
Safety cue: Stand tall with ribs down and sweep arms slowly to maintain shoulder control

Health benefit: Improves static balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
2. Keep hips level, shoulders relaxed, and gaze forward.
3. Hold the position while maintaining steady breathing and balance.
Safety cue: Stack heel to toe with hips level and gaze forward for balance

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and light cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and knees slightly bent.
2. Step to the side with one foot and touch the other foot next to it.
3. Repeat alternating sides at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Step deliberately with soft knees and an upright chest

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and improves postural control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on knees and forearms with elbows under shoulders.
2. Engage core and lift hips so body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Keep neck neutral and hold the position.
4. Lower hips back to the floor to rest.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep hips aligned with shoulders

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and boosts lower body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with back against a wall and feet hip-width apart a short distance away.
2. Slide down the wall until knees are bent about 90 degrees.
3. Keep weight in heels and hold the position.
Safety cue: Keep weight in your heels and knees tracking over ankles

Health benefit: Opens chest and increases shoulder extension range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall and interlace fingers behind your back.
2. Straighten arms and gently lift the clasped hands away from your back.
3. Open the chest by drawing shoulder blades together.
4. Hold the position briefly and release.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and keep your neck long

Health benefit: Improves ankle dorsiflexion and calf muscle flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back keeping that leg straight and the back heel on the floor.
3. Bend the front knee and lean toward the wall until you feel a stretch in the back calf.
4. Hold, then switch legs and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep back leg straight with heel down and maintain a tall posture

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and supports pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with your legs straight and your head supported by your hand.
2. Lift the top leg upward keeping hips stacked and toes pointing forward.
3. Lower the leg slowly with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift with control avoiding torso rotation

Health benefit: Enhances cervical range of motion and relieves neck tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and gaze forward.
2. Slowly turn your head to the right until you feel a gentle stretch.
3. Turn your head slowly to the left until you feel a gentle stretch and repeat.
Safety cue: Rotate head slowly within comfort keeping shoulders down and spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic core stability and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on your sit bones with knees bent and feet flat, hands by your shins.
2. Rock back onto your shoulder blades, keeping your chest lifted.
3. Rock forward onto your sit bones and balance tall.
4. Repeat the rocking motion with controlled movements.
Safety cue: Brace your core and move slowly to control each rocking motion

Health benefit: Improves hip extension strength and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Extend one leg straight back until it is level with your hip.
3. Keep hips square and lower the leg back to the starting position.
4. Repeat with the opposite leg while maintaining balance.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and extend the leg with slow, controlled motion

Health benefit: Boosts upper body muscular endurance and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hands up in a guard position.
2. Step slightly forward with one foot and snap a straight jab with the lead hand.
3. Retract the hand back to guard and alternate jabs quickly.
4. Keep weight light on your feet and maintain a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Tuck your chin, rotate through the torso and snap each jab with a controlled exhale

Health benefit: Improves pelvic mobility and lower back control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Tilt your pelvis to flatten your lower back against the floor.
3. Hold the tilt for a few seconds while breathing evenly.
4. Release to a neutral spine and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases wrist flexibility and reduces forearm tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm forward with the palm facing up.
2. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the fingers and wrist down toward you.
3. Hold the stretch for 20�30 seconds and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves thoracic spine mobility and rotational range
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and hips stacked.
2. Place your top hand behind your head and extend the bottom arm straight on the floor.
3. Rotate your upper torso to lift the top arm toward the ceiling and follow with your eyes.
4. Return the top arm to the floor in front of you and repeat in a controlled manner.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the upper back

Health benefit: Enhances hip external rotation and glute flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the floor with legs extended.
2. Cross your right ankle over your left knee and flex the right foot.
3. Hinge forward from the hips until you feel a stretch in the right buttock.
Safety cue: Sit tall and hinge forward from the hips to avoid rounding the lower back

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift your weight onto your heels, then rock forward onto your toes.
3. Continue rocking heel-to-toe in a controlled, rhythmic motion.
Safety cue: Shift slowly from heel to toe with controlled movement and upright posture

Health benefit: Improves rotational core stability and oblique activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Lean back slightly to create a stable diagonal and clasp your hands together.
3. Rotate your torso to the right, tapping the floor beside your hip.
4. Rotate to the left and repeat with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Brace the core and rotate from the ribs while keeping the feet grounded

Health benefit: Builds hip mobility and inner thigh strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned out.
2. Bend your knees and lower hips into a squat while pushing knees outward.
3. Keep your chest upright and weight evenly distributed.
4. Press through the heels to stand back up with control.
Safety cue: Push knees out over toes and keep weight in the heels with a straight spine

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and chest flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms extended forward at shoulder height and palms touching.
2. Open your arms wide out to the sides in a controlled motion.
3. Cross one arm over the other and then switch so the opposite arm crosses on the next repetition.
Safety cue: Move the arms with control and keep shoulders down away from the ears

Health benefit: Enhances multi joint mobility and movement integration
Steps to perform:
1. Step into a forward lunge with the right foot forward and hands on the ground inside the front foot.
2. Rotate your torso to the right and reach your right arm up toward the ceiling while keeping the left hand planted.
3. Return the right hand to the ground and bring both hands inside the front foot.
4. Repeat on the other side with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move slowly through each reach and rotation

Health benefit: Improves shoulder blade mobility and thoracic spine extension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift your chest slightly and sweep your right arm forward then down by your side while the left arm reaches back.
3. Alternate the arm motions smoothly to simulate a swimming stroke.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge slightly at the knees.
2. Push off one foot to step laterally and land softly on the other foot.
3. Shift weight and repeat the step back to the starting side.
4. Maintain a light spring and steady rhythm throughout.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest lifted

Health benefit: Improves upper back mobility and shoulder girdle flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and extend both arms forward at shoulder height.
2. Cross one arm over the other and bend elbows to wrap forearms, palms touching if possible.
3. Lift elbows and draw shoulder blades down the back.
4. Hold the wrapped position and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Pull shoulders down away from ears and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Enhances balance and proprioceptive control during gait
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other so toes and heel align.
2. Keep eyes forward and take small steps backward, placing toes to heel each step.
3. Maintain upright posture and controlled balance on each step.
Safety cue: Take slow controlled backward steps and keep the torso upright

Health benefit: Builds core stability and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Lift knees an inch off the ground and keep hips level.
3. Brace the core and hold the position with steady breathing.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace the core with shoulders over wrists

Health benefit: Promotes hip flexor activation and dynamic leg coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and drive one knee quickly toward your chest.
2. Lower that foot back to the ground with control.
3. Alternate knees in a steady, rhythmic manner.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and drive the knee with controlled hip flexion

Health benefit: Increases thoracic rotation and scapular mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees slightly bent and top arm extended on the floor.
2. Rotate your torso and reach the top arm up and across toward the far side.
3. Return the arm to the starting position with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Rotate from the thoracic spine and keep the hips stacked

Health benefit: Improves hip opening and lower body stability in single leg stance
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on one knee with the opposite leg extended to the side.
2. Keep hips square and slide your torso over the bent leg while reaching overhead.
3. Lower your hand toward the ankle and lengthen the side body.
4. Return upright and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Lengthen the spine and hinge from the hips with the supporting knee soft

Health benefit: Develops posterior chain strength and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a support nearby and hold it lightly with one hand.
2. Hinge at the hips on the standing leg and extend the other leg back for balance.
3. Lower your torso until it is near parallel, keeping the back straight.
4. Return to standing by driving the hip of the support leg forward.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens inner thigh muscles and improves medial hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs extended and top leg resting on the floor in front.
2. Lift the bottom leg upward toward the top leg using the inner thigh.
3. Lower the bottom leg with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and perform slow controlled lifts without twisting the torso

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one foot while keeping a soft knee.
2. Extend the opposite arm and opposite leg out to form a straight line.
3. Open the chest and reach the other arm diagonally upward to complete the star shape.
4. Hold the position and keep the supporting core engaged for balance.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and reach through the lifted leg while maintaining a tall spine

Health benefit: Improves lateral core activation and hip rotational mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold arms forward as if holding poles.
2. Shift weight side to side while swinging the arms and torso in a controlled lateral arc.
3. Keep a slight knee bend and alternate sides with fluid, skiing-like motion.
Safety cue: Drive the movement from the hips, keep chest up and maintain soft knees

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended out to the sides and forehead on the floor.
2. Bend one knee and lift the foot toward the opposite hand while keeping the pelvis grounded.
3. Rotate the knee across the body to bring the foot toward the floor near the opposite hand.
4. Return the leg to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Anchor the pelvis and rotate the leg with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and upper back flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and reach one arm overhead then bend the elbow to drop the hand between the shoulder blades.
2. Reach the other arm behind the back and climb the fingers up to meet the top hand.
3. Clasp the hands or hold a strap and lift the chest to deepen the shoulder stretch.
Safety cue: Lift the chest and draw the shoulder blades together to maintain alignment

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and cardiovascular fitness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold hands as if gripping a rope.
2. Rotate wrists in small circles and swing arms forward and backward to simulate rope rotation.
3. Jump lightly on the balls of your feet as each imaginary rope passes under and land softly.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and core engaged

Health benefit: Increases thoracic spine mobility and shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hips above knees and shoulders above wrists.
2. Walk hands forward and lower the chest toward the mat while keeping hips high.
3. Rest the forehead or chin on the floor and lengthen the spine.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and hip external rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto the left foot.
2. Cross the right thigh over the left and hook the right foot behind the left calf or use a strap to assist.
3. Bend the standing knee and sink the hips slightly while keeping the spine long.
4. Hold a support or bring hands to balance and keep the position steady.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, squeeze knees together, and maintain an upright spine

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands placed behind hips with fingers pointing toward feet.
2. Press into hands and heels to lift hips until the body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Squeeze the glutes, keep the neck neutral, and lower the hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a lateral step to the right leading with the right foot.
2. Cross the left foot behind the right, then step the right foot to the right again.
3. Continue the crossing pattern slowly for a set distance, then repeat to the left.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso, rotate hips and shoulders together, and step with control

Health benefit: Improves shoulder and chest mobility and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended out to the sides and legs straight.
2. Lift one leg and cross it slowly over the midline toward the opposite side while keeping shoulders flat.
3. Hold briefly and trace the leg back to center with control.
4. Repeat on the opposite side for equal reps.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders anchored to the floor and move arms with slow controlled range of motion

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and enhances standing balance
Steps to perform:
1. Step one foot forward into a lunge with the front knee bent and the back foot turned slightly out.
2. Square the hips to face forward and lift the torso upright.
3. Reach both arms overhead and draw the shoulder blades down.
4. Press into both feet and sink deeper into the front knee while keeping weight balanced.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops hip strength and improves squat and hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes angled slightly outward.
2. Hinge at the hips and push the knees outward while lowering the torso with a flat back.
3. Drive the hips forward and squeeze the glutes to return to standing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart with knees soft and core engaged.
2. Raise one fist toward the ceiling with elbow slightly bent.
3. Snap the fist upward and slightly forward while rotating the shoulder.
4. Lower with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and core braced as you punch upward

Health benefit: Enhances ankle mobility and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended or supported and feet relaxed.
2. Turn the sole of one foot inward to feel inversion.
3. Turn the sole of the same foot outward to feel eversion.
Safety cue: Move the ankle slowly with control and keep the foot aligned under the shin

Health benefit: Improves lateral torso flexibility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wide and arms extended at shoulder height.
2. Turn front foot forward and back foot slightly in.
3. Reach the front hand toward the front ankle and lift the opposite arm up.
4. Keep length through the torso and hold the position.
Safety cue: Stack the hips and maintain a long spine while reaching through the top arm

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and posterior chain stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand near a chair or wall for support with feet hip-width.
2. Shift weight onto the front foot and hinge at the hips while extending the rear leg.
3. Place one hand on the support or extend both arms for balance.
4. Keep a straight spine and hold the position steady.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee soft and hinge from the hips with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a split stance with one foot forward and one foot back.
2. Lower hips by bending the front knee until the front thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Keep torso upright and weight over the front heel.
4. Push through the front heel to return to the start and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the front knee tracking over the toes and maintain an upright torso

Health benefit: Improves running coordination and hip flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and begin alternating high knee drives with opposite arm swings.
2. Land softly on the forefoot and snap the ankle to propel the next step.
3. Maintain a rhythmic cadence and drive knees up with each skip.
Safety cue: Maintain tall posture, drive the knee up, and control each landing

Health benefit: Promotes hip external rotation and glute flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and cross the right ankle over the left thigh above the knee.
2. Sit back into a shallow squat while holding support if needed.
3. Lean forward slightly to increase the stretch and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee soft and chest lifted while hinging from the hips

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and hip flexor engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and lift the opposite knee toward the chest.
2. Wrap both hands around the shin and pull the knee gently toward the body.
3. Hold balance on the standing leg with core engaged and switch sides.
Safety cue: Engage the core and maintain a straight spine while balancing on one leg

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral core muscles and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and prop your upper body on your forearm.
2. Stack knees and lift hips off the ground to form a straight line from shoulder to knees.
3. Reach the top arm toward the ceiling and keep hips lifted.
4. Hold the position and lower with control.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over elbow and lift hips into a straight line from knees to shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and full body dynamic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms by your sides.
2. Jump feet wide while sweeping arms out and clapping palms together at chest level.
3. Jump feet back together while returning arms to your sides and lightly tapping palms.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and core engaged throughout the movement

Health benefit: Builds core engagement while improving hamstring flexibility and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hinge at the hips to place hands on the floor.
2. Walk hands forward until your body forms a straight plank position.
3. Pause briefly in plank and then walk hands back toward your feet.
Safety cue: Hinge from your hips and maintain a braced core with a flat back

Health benefit: Increases hamstring and lower back flexibility and promotes hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with legs wider than hip-width and toes pointing slightly inward.
2. Hinge at the hips and fold forward, keeping the spine long and chest toward the floor.
3. Relax the neck and reach hands toward the floor or shins while breathing evenly.
Safety cue: Keep a long spine and hinge from the hips, softening the knees as needed

Health benefit: Improves balance and lateral stability while strengthening glutes and obliques
Steps to perform:
1. Stand sideways next to a wall with the lower hand touching the wall at hip height.
2. Shift weight onto the front foot and hinge forward while lifting the back leg parallel to the floor.
3. Open the top hip and reach the top arm toward the ceiling while keeping the lower hand on the wall.
4. Square the hips, fix your gaze on the top hand, then lower the lifted leg to return to standing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases heart rate while engaging upper back muscles.
Steps to perform: 1. Step right foot out, pull elbows back.2. Step feet together, extend arms.3. Repeat on left side.
Safety cue: Keep chest up; do not shrug shoulders.

Health benefit: Improves hip coordination and burns calories gently.
Steps to perform: 1. March 4 steps with feet wide.2. March 4 steps with feet narrow.3. Keep a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Land softly on balls of feet.

Health benefit: Coordinates upper and lower body movement.
Steps to perform: 1. Tap right heel forward, curl arms up.2. Return to start.3. Repeat with left heel.
Safety cue: Keep elbows pinned to ribs.

Health benefit: Engages oblique muscles and elevates heart rate.
Steps to perform: 1. Pivot right foot, punch right arm left.2. Return to center.3. Repeat on other side.
Safety cue: Pivot the foot to protect the knee.

Health benefit: Activates hamstrings without impact.
Steps to perform: 1. Shift weight to left leg.2. Curl right heel toward glute.3. Alternate sides rhythmically.
Safety cue: Keep knees pointing down, not forward.

Health benefit: Mobilizes the thoracic spine during cardio.
Steps to perform: 1. Lift right knee, twist torso right.2. Return to center.3. Lift left knee, twist torso left.
Safety cue: Twist from ribs, not the lower back.

Health benefit: Very low intensity movement for blood flow.
Steps to perform: 1. Step wide, shift weight right.2. Shift weight left.3. Let arms hang loose.
Safety cue: Keep knees soft, never locked.

Health benefit: Low impact ankle mobilization and cardio.
Steps to perform: 1. Tap right toes forward.2. Return to center.3. Tap left toes forward.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso.

Health benefit: Builds shoulder endurance and coordination.
Steps to perform: 1. Raise fists to chest height.2. Rotate fists over each other rapidly.3. Keep lower body active.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down away from ears.

Health benefit: Strengthens hip flexors and core.
Steps to perform: 1. Lift right knee to hip height.2. Lower control.3. Alternate legs.
Safety cue: Avoid rounding the back.

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors gently.
Steps to perform: 1. Step right foot out to side.2. Bring left foot to meet it.3. Step back to start.
Safety cue: Keep toes pointing forward.

Health benefit: Corrects posture while walking in place.
Steps to perform: 1. March in place.2. Pull elbows back firmly.3. Release forward.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together.

Health benefit: Improves spatial awareness and agility.
Steps to perform: 1. Take 4 small steps forward.2. Pause.3. Take 4 small steps backward.
Safety cue: Look ahead, not at feet.

Health benefit: Stretches lateral line and works core.
Steps to perform: 1. Reach right arm over head.2. Tap right toe to side.3. Return and switch.
Safety cue: Avoid arching the lower back.

Health benefit: Basic rhythmic movement for warm-up.
Steps to perform: 1. Step right, tap left toe next to it.2. Step left, tap right toe.3. Keep hands still at chest.
Safety cue: Keep weight in the heels.

Health benefit: Challenges multidirectional hip stability.
Steps to perform: 1. Step diagonally forward right.2. Step diagonally forward left.3. Walk backward in same pattern.
Safety cue: Keep hips facing forward.

Health benefit: Engages cross-body coordination brain/body.
Steps to perform: 1. Lift right knee, touch with left hand.2. Lift left knee, touch with right hand.3. Repeat rhythmically.
Safety cue: Focus on stability over speed.

Health benefit: Safe mobilization for knees and hips.
Steps to perform: 1. Extend right leg, touch heel to floor.2. Step back.3. Repeat left leg.
Safety cue: Keep standing knee soft.

Health benefit: Activates rotators without torque on knees.
Steps to perform: 1. Plant feet shoulder width.2. Twist torso gentle left and right.3. Allow heels to lift slightly.
Safety cue: Lift heel to protect knee joint.

Health benefit: Strengthens back muscles without weights.
Steps to perform: 1. Reach arms high (or comfortable height).2. Pull elbows down to ribs.3. Squeeze lats at bottom.
Safety cue: Do not jut head forward.

Health benefit: Works outer hips minimally.
Steps to perform: 1. Tap right toe out to side.2. Bring back to center.3. Alternate sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level.

Health benefit: Tones arms and core.
Steps to perform: 1. Punch right fist upwards close to body.2. Punch left fist upwards.3. Use legs to drive movement.
Safety cue: Don't punch yourself; control stop.

Health benefit: Full body cardiovascular engagement.
Steps to perform: 1. March knees high.2. Swing straight arms vigorously.3. Breathe rhythmically.
Safety cue: Opposing arm and leg move together.

Health benefit: Core flexion without lying down.
Steps to perform: 1. Hands behind ears.2. Bring right knee to right elbow.3. Alternate.
Safety cue: Don't pull on the neck.

Health benefit: Lateral agility and coordination.
Steps to perform: 1. Step right, close left.2. Step right again, close left.3. Repeat to left side.
Safety cue: Stay light on feet.

Health benefit: Pushing strength and lunging mechanics.
Steps to perform: 1. Step forward right.2. Push arms forward at chest level.3. Return.
Safety cue: Keep core braced.

Health benefit: Dynamic adductor/inner thigh work.
Steps to perform: 1. Feet wider than hips.2. Shift hips right, straighten left leg.3. Shift hips left.
Safety cue: Push hips back, don't bend fwd.

Health benefit: Inner thigh activation.
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall.2. Click heels together lightly.3. Step out and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep knees straight but not locked.

Health benefit: Continuous upper body cardio.
Steps to perform: 1. Roll fists over each other forward.2. Maintain chest height.3. March feet simultaneously.
Safety cue: Keep elbows active, not drooping.

Health benefit: Cardio without overhead arm impact.
Steps to perform: 1. Tap right foot side.2. Return center.3. Tap left foot side.
Safety cue: Keep upper body still.

Health benefit: Glute activation and balance.
Steps to perform: 1. Tap right toe straight back.2. Squeeze right glute.3. Return and switch.
Safety cue: Don't arch lower back.

Health benefit: Mimics ladder climbing for full body.
Steps to perform: 1. Reach right arm up, lift left knee.2. Pull arm down, step foot down.3. Switch sides.
Safety cue: Reach only as high as pain-free.

Health benefit: Spatial orientation and hip rotation.
Steps to perform: 1. Step right foot forward.2. Turn 180 degrees to face back.3. Step right foot forward again.
Safety cue: Lift heels to pivot safely.

Health benefit: Lateral spine mobility.
Steps to perform: 1. Feet planted.2. Reach right arm down right leg.3. Return to vertical.
Safety cue: Imagine sliding between two panes of glass.

Health benefit: Calf strengthening and cardio.
Steps to perform: 1. Rise onto balls of feet.2. March quickly and lightly.3. Keep heels off ground.
Safety cue: Maintain posture, look forward.

Health benefit: Upper back endurance.
Steps to perform: 1. Arms in front, palms touching.2. Open arms wide to T-shape.3. Squeeze shoulder blades.
Safety cue: Do not flare ribs.

Health benefit: Leg strength and deceleration.
Steps to perform: 1. Step forward right (short stride).2. Push off right heel to return.3. Alternate.
Safety cue: Do not let knee pass toe.

Health benefit: Oblique strength.
Steps to perform: 1. Hand behind head.2. Lift knee sideways toward elbow.3. Crunch side waist.
Safety cue: Don't pull neck forward.

Health benefit: Multi-planar movement.
Steps to perform: 1. Step diagonally fwd right.2. Touch left toe to right.3. Step back to start.
Safety cue: Keep core engaged.

Health benefit: Core rotation and power.
Steps to perform: 1. Arm at 90 degrees.2. Rotate hip and hook punch across.3. Reset.
Safety cue: Pivot the foot with the punch.

Health benefit: Mental connection to glutes.
Steps to perform: 1. Step forward.2. Consciously squeeze rear leg glute.3. Step next foot.
Safety cue: Torso stays vertical.

Health benefit: Core rotation.
Steps to perform: 1. Hands at chest.2. Twist torso left, look left.3. Twist right.
Safety cue: Move hips and shoulders together.

Health benefit: Hip adductor/abductor agility.
Steps to perform: 1. Wide stance.2. Shift weight to tap right toe.3. Shift left.
Safety cue: Keep knees slightly bent.

Health benefit: Rear deltoid activation.
Steps to perform: 1. Arms extended front.2. Pull hands apart horizontally.3. Return.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down.

Health benefit: Coordination and fun cardio.
Steps to perform: 1. Step forward right, kick left.2. Step back left, tap right back.3. Repeat.
Safety cue: Keep kicks low.

Health benefit: Ipsilateral core work.
Steps to perform: 1. Lift right knee.2. Touch right elbow to knee.3. Lower.
Safety cue: Balance on standing leg first.

Health benefit: Posterior chain stretch and cardio.
Steps to perform: 1. Step right foot forward.2. Reach opposite hand toward toe.3. Return.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips, keep back flat.

Health benefit: Lateral agility.
Steps to perform: 1. Shuffle right 2 steps.2. Shuffle left 2 steps.3. Stay on toes.
Safety cue: Don't cross feet.

Health benefit: Chest activation.
Steps to perform: 1. Arms out to sides.2. Bring palms together in front.3. Open back up.
Safety cue: Slight bend in elbows.

Health benefit: Cognitive and footwork challenge.
Steps to perform: 1. Step Right-Out, Left-Out.2. Step Right-In, Left-In.3. Repeat rapidly.
Safety cue: Say "Out, Out, In, In" to rhythm.

Health benefit: Opens chest and stretches upper back.
Steps to perform: 1. Open arms wide.2. Cross arms to hug self.3. Alternate top arm.
Safety cue: Don't fling arms back violently.

Health benefit: Loosens stiffness in the spine.
Steps to perform: 1. Feet hip-width.2. Let arms swing as torso twists.3. Look where you twist.
Safety cue: Lift heel to protect knees.

Health benefit: Releases upper trap tension.
Steps to perform: 1. Shrug one shoulder up.2. Roll it back and down.3. Alternate sides.
Safety cue: Keep neck long.

Health benefit: Warms up chest and rear delts.
Steps to perform: 1. Arms straight out front.2. Cross right over left.3. Open and switch cross.
Safety cue: Keep core tight.

Health benefit: Improves cervical rotation.
Steps to perform: 1. Turn head slowly right.2. Return center.3. Turn left.
Safety cue: Move only within comfort range.

Health benefit: Mobilizes lumbar and thoracic spine.
Steps to perform: 1. Hands on thighs, bend knees.2. Arch back (Cow).3. Round back (Cat).
Safety cue: Move slowly and breathe.

Health benefit: Prepares wrists for loading/movement.
Steps to perform: 1. Arm straight.2. Flex hand up (Stop sign).3. Flex hand down.
Safety cue: Don't force the stretch.

Health benefit: Lubricates elbow joint.
Steps to perform: 1. Arms out, bend elbows.2. Circle forearms inward.3. Circle outward.
Safety cue: Isolate movement to elbows.

Health benefit: Stretches posterior shoulder.
Steps to perform: 1. Pull right arm across chest.2. Hold 1 sec.3. Open and switch.
Safety cue: Keep shoulder down.

Health benefit: Opens tight pecs/shoulders.
Steps to perform: 1. Arms in "cactus" shape.2. Pulse elbows back 1 inch.3. Release.
Safety cue: Keep ribs tucked in.

Health benefit: Mobilizes shoulder blades.
Steps to perform: 1. Arms forward.2. Reach forward (separate blades).3. Return to neutral.
Safety cue: Keep elbows straight.

Health benefit: Stretches triceps and lats.
Steps to perform: 1. Reach right hand down back.2. Gentle push on elbow.3. Switch arms.
Safety cue: Don't arch back.

Health benefit: Increases blood flow to hands.
Steps to perform: 1. Squeeze fists tight.2. Spread fingers wide.3. Repeat rapidly.
Safety cue: Keep wrists neutral.

Health benefit: Opens side body/intercostals.
Steps to perform: 1. Reach right arm overhead.2. Lean left.3. Return and switch.
Safety cue: Keep hips steady.

Health benefit: Rotational shoulder mobility.
Steps to perform: 1. Draw "8" with hand in air.2. Let torso follow slightly.3. Switch arms.
Safety cue: Smooth, fluid motion.

Health benefit: Stretches lateral neck muscles.
Steps to perform: 1. Drop right ear to shoulder.2. Hold 2 sec.3. Switch sides.
Safety cue: Do not lift shoulder to ear.

Health benefit: Activates lower traps.
Steps to perform: 1. Elbows at ribs (W shape).2. Press up and out (Y shape).3. Return to W.
Safety cue: Squeeze blades in W.

Health benefit: Mobilizes radioulnar joints.
Steps to perform: 1. Elbows at 90 degrees.2. Palms up.3. Palms down.
Safety cue: Keep elbows at sides.

Health benefit: Full spine articulation.
Steps to perform: 1. Tuck chin, roll down.2. Bend knees.3. Roll up vertebrae by vertebrae.
Safety cue: Move sequentially.

Health benefit: Stretches wrist flexors.
Steps to perform: 1. Palms together at chest.2. Lower hands until stretch felt.3. Raise and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep palms touching.

Health benefit: Shoulder rotation mobility.
Steps to perform: 1. Hands on shoulders.2. Lift elbows up.3. Lower elbows down.
Safety cue: Full range of motion.

Health benefit: Chest opening without load.
Steps to perform: 1. Arms wide.2. Bring hands together.3. Open wide.
Safety cue: Focus on the stretch back.

Health benefit: Thoracic rotation.
Steps to perform: 1. Hands on thighs.2. Reach right arm under left.3. Open right arm up.
Safety cue: Follow hand with eyes.

Health benefit: Shoulder flexion mobility.
Steps to perform: 1. Raise right arm forward.2. As it lowers, raise left.3. Scissor motion.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down.

Health benefit: Scapular control/mobility.
Steps to perform: 1. Shrug up.2. Roll back.3. Depress down and fwd.
Safety cue: Isolate the shoulder blade.

Health benefit: Loosens hip flexors/hamstrings.
Steps to perform: 1. Hold wall.2. Swing leg forward and back.3. Keep torso quiet.
Safety cue: Don't arch back on backswing.

Health benefit: Loosens adductors/abductors.
Steps to perform: 1. Hold wall.2. Swing leg across body and out.3. Keep toe forward.
Safety cue: Avoid twisting the planted knee.

Health benefit: Dynamically stretches quads.
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall.2. Kick heel to glute.3. Switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep knees pointing down.

Health benefit: Hip mobility and balance.
Steps to perform: 1. Hug knee to chest.2. Step it back into lunge.3. Repeat.
Safety cue: Step back carefully.

Health benefit: Hip rotation mobility.
Steps to perform: 1. Lift knee forward.2. Rotate knee out to side.3. Lower foot.
Safety cue: Keep hips square forward.

Health benefit: Stretches calves/achilles.
Steps to perform: 1. Hands on wall, split stance.2. Press back heel down.3. Lift and press repeatedly.
Safety cue: Keep back leg straight.

Health benefit: Mobilizes ankle joint.
Steps to perform: 1. Feet hip width.2. Roll to outside edges.3. Roll to inside edges.
Safety cue: Gentle movement only.

Health benefit: Hamstring stretch.
Steps to perform: 1. Heel down, toe up.2. Sweep hands toward floor.3. Stand up.
Safety cue: Keep back flat.

Health benefit: Active hamstring stretch.
Steps to perform: 1. Kick right leg straight front.2. Reach left hand to toe.3. Alternate.
Safety cue: Only kick to comfort height.

Health benefit: Core and hip integration.
Steps to perform: 1. Hands behind head.2. Lift knee, twist torso toward it.3. Switch.
Safety cue: Don't pull head.

Health benefit: Groin stretch.
Steps to perform: 1. Wide stance.2. Bend right knee, keep left straight.3. Shift to left knee.
Safety cue: Keep heels down.

Health benefit: Stretches front thigh.
Steps to perform: 1. Grab foot, pull to glute.2. Release immediately.3. Switch legs.
Safety cue: Use wall if unbalanced.

Health benefit: Strengthens/stretches posterior chain.
Steps to perform: 1. Hands behind head.2. Hinge at hips, back flat.3. Squeeze glutes to stand.
Safety cue: Soft bend in knees.

Health benefit: Hip opening.
Steps to perform: 1. Wide stance, toes out.2. Lower into squat.3. Pulse twice and stand.
Safety cue: Knees track over toes.

Health benefit: Balance training.
Steps to perform: 1. Step one foot directly in front of other.2. Touch heel to toe.3. Walk line.
Safety cue: Look forward, not down.

Health benefit: External hip rotation.
Steps to perform: 1. Place ankle on elevated surface (chair).2. Lean forward slightly.3. Release and switch.
Safety cue: Keep knee safe/pain-free.

Health benefit: Knee joint lubrication.
Steps to perform: 1. Feet together, hands on knees.2. Circle knees gently right.3. Circle left.
Safety cue: Very small range of motion.

Health benefit: Hip flexor + thoracic stretch.
Steps to perform: 1. Step back lunge.2. Twist torso over front leg.3. Return.
Safety cue: Twist from torso, not knee.

Health benefit: Plantar fascia stretch.
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall.2. Lift one heel, press other down.3. Rapidly switch (prancing).
Safety cue: Roll through the toes.

Health benefit: Multi-joint warmup.
Steps to perform: 1. Hinge hips back.2. Drop hips into squat.3. Stand up.
Safety cue: Keep chest up in squat.

Health benefit: Adductor length.
Steps to perform: 1. Wide stance.2. Lean to right.3. Reach left arm over head.
Safety cue: Keep leg straight.

Health benefit: Outer hip stretch.
Steps to perform: 1. Tap right foot behind left.2. Small bend in knees.3. Return.
Safety cue: Keep hips square.

Health benefit: Hamstring activation.
Steps to perform: 1. March forward.2. Keep legs straight.3. Land on mid-foot.
Safety cue: Don't lean backward.

Health benefit: Shin activation.
Steps to perform: 1. Heel planted.2. Tap toes up and down fast.3. Burn in shin feels good.
Safety cue: Keep heel down.

Health benefit: Full front line stretch.
Steps to perform: 1. Step back right leg.2. Reach right arm high.3. Return.
Safety cue: Tuck tailbone slightly.

Health benefit: Enhances quadriceps activation and knee stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with both feet flat on the floor.
2. Straighten one knee and tighten the front thigh muscle.
3. Press the back of the knee down into the seat and hold.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and knee aligned while gently contracting the quadriceps

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and standing balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and shoulders against a wall and feet hip-width apart.
2. Step the feet slightly forward so knees are over the toes.
3. Slide down the wall by bending the knees to a shallow squat.
4. Press through the heels and straighten to standing.
Safety cue: Keep weight in the heels and chest lifted with knees tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs straight and stacked.
2. Support your head with your bottom arm and keep hips squared.
3. Lift the top leg upward in a controlled motion.
4. Lower the leg slowly back to the start.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift the leg with slow controlled movement from the hip

Health benefit: Enhances core rotational control and low back mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit near the edge of a chair with knees bent and feet off the floor.
2. Lean back slightly keeping the spine long and brace the core.
3. Rotate the knees together to one side and then to the other like wipers.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move the legs slowly without jerking

Health benefit: Improves calf strength and ankle push off power
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with one knee bent and the forefoot supported by your hands or a band.
2. Place your hands on the ball of the foot to provide resistance.
3. Press the toes and forefoot down as if pointing the foot.
4. Hold the press and then relax the foot back to neutral.
Safety cue: Stabilize the ankle and press through the ball of the foot with controlled force

Health benefit: Strengthens peroneal muscles and enhances lateral ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with the knee bent and the foot relaxed on the floor.
2. Place the inside edge of the foot against a stable object or your hand.
3. Push the sole outward against the resistance without moving the ankle.
Safety cue: Keep the ankle steady and resist outward without lifting the heel

Health benefit: Supports foot intrinsic strength and improves arch support
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with both feet flat on the floor and toes and heels touching the surface.
2. Keep toes and heel planted and lift only the arch of the foot.
3. Hold the lifted arch briefly and then relax it back down.
Safety cue: Shorten the foot by lifting the arch while keeping toes relaxed and the heel grounded

Health benefit: Promotes balance and reinforces hip and leg weight transfer
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes pointing forward.
2. Shift your weight to one leg by bending that knee and moving your hips toward it.
3. Return to center and repeat the shift to the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Shift weight slowly with hips level and knees tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Enhances deep core engagement and spinal support during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Draw your belly button gently toward your spine to engage the core.
3. Maintain a neutral spine and keep the breath steady while holding the brace.
Safety cue: Exhale and draw the belly gently toward the spine while keeping the low back neutral

Health benefit: Improves pelvic mobility awareness and coordinated pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, imagine a clock on your pelvis.
2. Tilt the pelvis gently toward 12 o'clock to perform a posterior tilt.
3. Tilt the pelvis toward 6 o'clock for an anterior tilt and then toward 3 and 9 o'clock for lateral shifts.
4. Return to the neutral center between each movement.
Safety cue: Use small controlled pelvic motions and keep the low back gently contacting the mat

Health benefit: Improves neck posture and deep cervical flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and head resting on the floor.
2. Tuck your chin and slide your head straight back along the surface without lifting it.
3. Hold the retracted position briefly then relax back to neutral.
Safety cue: Tuck the chin and keep the neck long with shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and upper back movement efficiency
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and hands crossed over your chest.
2. Rotate your upper back to one side while keeping your hips facing forward.
3. Glide the thoracic spine back to center and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall and glide from the thoracic spine while keeping the lumbar stable

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and posterior chain endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one arm at your side and the palm facing backward.
2. Press the back of your hand gently against a wall or immovable surface without moving the arm.
3. Hold the contraction for a short count then relax.
Safety cue: Hold the extension with scapulae depressed and torso steady

Health benefit: Encourages scapular mobility and controlled shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit at a table with forearms resting on the surface and palms down.
2. Push your forearms forward, sliding your hands away while keeping the elbows on the table.
3. Return your hands to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Slide the arms with elbows tracking under shoulders and chest open

Health benefit: Promotes elbow alignment and forearm muscle engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with your elbow bent and the upper arm resting against your side.
2. Squeeze the elbow into your side using the muscles around the shoulder and hold.
3. Release the squeeze and reset for the next repetition.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to your sides and squeeze evenly without shrugging

Health benefit: Increases biceps tension and upper arm stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with your arm bent at 90 degrees and palm facing up.
2. Place your other hand or a fixed object against your palm to provide resistance.
3. Press the hand into the resistance without allowing the arm to move.
4. Hold the contraction then slowly relax.
Safety cue: Brace the core and keep the elbow fixed while contracting the biceps

Health benefit: Improves forearm rotational control and wrist coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your forearm supported on a table and your elbow bent to 90 degrees.
2. Rotate your palm from facing up to facing down while keeping the forearm on the surface.
3. Return the palm to facing up with control.
Safety cue: Anchor the forearm and rotate slowly with controlled wrist movement

Health benefit: Enhances chest flexibility and improves shoulder opening
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a corner and place your forearms on each wall at a low height below shoulder level.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest toward the corner while keeping a neutral spine.
3. Hold the stretch briefly and return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and ribs down as you lean from the chest into the stretch

Health benefit: Develops scapular upward rotation and overhead movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and hips against a wall and raise your arms so elbows are bent wide at shoulder height.
2. Press your entire arms and elbows into the wall.
3. Slowly slide your arms upward along the wall while maintaining contact.
4. Slide the arms back down to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Facilitates spinal lengthening and integrates full body posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall at the edge of a chair with feet flat and hands resting on your thighs.
2. Inhale and reach both arms overhead while lengthening through the spine.
3. Exhale and lower your arms while maintaining an upright posture.
Safety cue: Reach tall with a braced core and extend through the full spine

Health benefit: Boosts heart rate and promotes light cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall at the front of a chair with feet flat.
2. Lift one knee quickly toward your chest, then lower it and lift the other.
3. Swing your arms and keep a rapid, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain upright posture and brace your core while controlling each rapid knee lift

Health benefit: Improves hamstring activation and knee joint mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall holding the back of a chair for support.
2. Bend one knee and bring the heel toward your buttocks in a smooth motion.
3. Lower the foot slowly and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and hinge from the knee while controlling the heel toward the glute

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with hips stacked and knees bent about 90 degrees.
2. Keep feet together and maintain a stable pelvis.
3. Lift the top knee upward while keeping the feet touching.
4. Lower the knee with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Activates gluteal muscles and supports hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your stomach with legs straight and forehead resting on your hands.
2. Squeeze the glute of one leg and lift the heel a few inches off the floor.
3. Lower the leg with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and contract the glute to lift through a small controlled range

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with one leg extended and the ankle unsupported.
2. Move the ankle to "write" the letters of the alphabet with your big toe.
3. Repeat the sequence with the other ankle.
Safety cue: Stabilize the lower leg and move only the ankle through slow controlled letters

Health benefit: Challenges balance and enhances single limb stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the toes.
2. Keep arms relaxed or hold a chair for light support and look straight ahead.
3. Hold the position steadily, then switch the lead foot.
Safety cue: Stand heel to toe with a soft knee and steady breath to maintain balance

Health benefit: Enhances intrinsic foot muscle strength and toe coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat on the floor and heels planted.
2. Spread all toes apart as wide as possible and hold briefly.
3. Release the toes and repeat for the desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep the foot flat and actively spread the toes while relaxing the ankle

Health benefit: Improves ankle flexibility and weight transfer control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and lightly hold a chair or wall for support.
2. Rock forward onto the toes, lifting the heels, then rock back onto the heels, lifting the toes.
3. Perform the rocks in a controlled, steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep weight centered over the feet and rock slowly with an upright posture

Health benefit: Engages core muscles and promotes postural alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width a few inches away.
2. Draw your belly button toward your spine and tilt the pelvis to press the lower back gently against the wall.
3. Hold the tilt briefly, then release and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Stretches hips and lower back while encouraging relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on a mat with knees spread wide and big toes touching.
2. Sit back toward your heels and lower your torso between your thighs.
3. Extend your arms forward and rest your forehead on the mat.
4. Relax your shoulders and hold the position.
Safety cue: Lengthen the spine and breathe deeply into the back while keeping the shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Improves scapular retraction and upper back muscle engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on a firm surface with your forehead resting and arms at your sides.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and down without lifting your chest.
3. Hold the squeeze while breathing normally.
4. Relax your shoulders back to the start position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and squeeze shoulder blades down and together

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and stacked and your bottom arm extended forward.
2. Place your top hand behind your head and rotate your chest open toward the ceiling.
3. Keep your hips steady and return the top hand to the starting position.
4. Repeat the rotation slowly for the prescribed reps.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the thoracic spine with controlled motion

Health benefit: Boosts shoulder endurance and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hands in light fists at chin level.
2. Bend your knees slightly and shift weight into a quick, rhythmic stance.
3. Throw small, fast punches to the midsection with alternating hands.
4. Keep your hands returning quickly to guard after each punch.
Safety cue: Stabilize the shoulder blades and keep elbows slightly bent with controlled punches

Health benefit: Promotes gentle shoulder joint mobility and fluid movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lean forward and support your non-working hand on a table or chair.
2. Let the working arm hang relaxed and make small clockwise circles from the shoulder.
3. Reverse the direction and make small counterclockwise circles for the same time.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips, relax the arm, and make small controlled circles from the shoulder

Health benefit: Builds rotator cuff stability and controlled internal rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with your elbow bent to 90 degrees and a towel or strap under your forearm.
2. Press your forearm inward against a fixed object without moving the shoulder.
3. Hold the contraction firmly and then relax the pressure.
Safety cue: Keep the elbow tucked to your side and maintain a neutral wrist while pressing inward

Health benefit: Improves aerobic capacity and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a boxing stance with feet staggered and hands up by your chin.
2. Rotate your torso and drive a short, upward punch into the opponent�s body with your lead hand.
3. Return your hand to guard and repeat with the rear hand.
4. Move your feet lightly between punches to maintain balance.
Safety cue: Rotate through the hips and exhale with each punch while keeping the chin tucked

Health benefit: Strengthens wrist alignment and upper body pressing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart and hands in fist position on the wall at chest height.
2. Keep your body straight and lower your chest toward the wall by bending the elbows.
3. Push back to the start position using your chest and triceps while keeping knuckles on the wall.
Safety cue: Keep wrists neutral and shoulders aligned over the knuckles with core engaged

Health benefit: Enhances posterior chain activation and thoracic extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms resting alongside your body and palms down.
2. Squeeze your glutes and gently lift your chest a few inches while keeping the arms on the floor.
3. Hold the lifted position briefly and then lower back down.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Encourages lateral mobility and light cardiovascular movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands on your hips and feet together.
2. Step one foot to the side and bring the other foot to meet it with a light tap.
3. Continue stepping side to side with a steady, rhythmic pace.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright posture and step with control without letting the hips sway

Health benefit: Improves balance and proprioception through controlled rhythmic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and relax your shoulders.
2. Shift your weight slowly onto one foot and lift the other foot a few inches while maintaining balance.
3. Place the lifted foot down heel first and transfer your weight smoothly onto it.
4. Repeat the movement slowly with the opposite foot, keeping a calm, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Transfer weight slowly with controlled steps and maintain a tall upright posture

Health benefit: Improves core strength and seated trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a mat with knees bent and hands placed behind your hips for support.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the floor to form a V with torso and thighs.
3. Extend your legs to a comfortable angle and keep your core engaged.
4. Hold the position while keeping your chest lifted and breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand near a wall with feet hip-width apart and hands relaxed at your sides.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the other foot off the floor.
3. Reach the free hand forward to touch the wall lightly and maintain balance.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and knee slightly bent to maintain controlled balance

Health benefit: Strengthens hip adductors and supports pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat on the floor and knees slightly apart.
2. Squeeze your knees together until they gently touch.
3. Hold the squeeze briefly and then release slowly to the start position.
Safety cue: Sit tall and squeeze through the inner thighs while keeping spine neutral

Health benefit: Increases hip mobility and glute activation
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on one knee with the other foot planted forward in a lunge stance.
2. Shift weight into the front leg and lift your torso upright.
3. Pulse by bending and straightening the front knee a few inches.
4. Keep your core engaged and repeat for the desired number of pulses before switching sides.
Safety cue: Keep front knee aligned over the ankle and pulse with control

Health benefit: Builds ankle dorsiflexion strength and improves gait mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and toes lifted off the floor.
2. Shift weight onto your heels so the toes remain raised.
3. Walk forward a short distance while keeping toes elevated and posture upright.
Safety cue: Keep toes lifted and walk with controlled even steps

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles while challenging single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand next to a stable surface and place one hand lightly on it for support.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the other foot off the floor.
3. Rise onto the ball of the standing foot by lifting the heel as high as comfortable.
4. Lower slowly back to flat and repeat for the desired reps, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep weight centered over the midfoot and rise slowly through the heel

Health benefit: Improves calf flexibility and ankle range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with one leg extended and loop a towel around the ball of the foot.
2. Keep the knee straight and gently pull the towel toward you until you feel a stretch in the calf.
3. Hold the stretch for the desired time, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep spine long and dorsiflex the ankle by pulling the towel with control

Health benefit: Develops core stability and coordinated trunk limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and arms at your sides.
2. Engage your core and press the low back gently toward the floor.
3. Slowly slide one heel along the floor away from your body until the leg straightens partially.
4. Reverse the slide to return to start and repeat with the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves neck alignment and deep cervical flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Draw your chin straight back toward your throat without lifting your head.
3. Hold briefly, then relax and return to the neutral position.
Safety cue: Gently tuck the chin while keeping the neck long and spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with hips and knees slightly bent and both arms stacked.
2. Extend the top arm straight out in front of you at shoulder height.
3. Rotate your top shoulder and open your chest, moving the top arm across your body and toward the opposite side.
4. Return the arm to the start position with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Rotate the thoracic spine while keeping hips stacked and knees together

Health benefit: Improves shoulder circulation and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift your shoulders up toward your ears in a controlled motion.
3. Roll your shoulders back and then down to complete the circle.
Safety cue: Roll shoulders slowly through a full range while keeping your core engaged

Health benefit: Strengthens external rotators for shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your elbow bent at 90 degrees and the outside of your forearm against a wall or door frame.
2. Keep your upper arm close to your side and press the back of your hand outward into the surface without moving the shoulder.
3. Hold the press briefly, then release and relax.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves posterior chain activation and upper back extension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with your arms at your sides and palms down.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your chest and hands off the floor while keeping your neck neutral.
3. Hold briefly, then lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Lift the chest with shoulder blades down and back while avoiding neck hyperextension

Health benefit: Enhances anterior shoulder mobility and chest flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright near the edge of a chair with feet flat on the floor.
2. Interlace your fingers behind your lower back and straighten your arms.
3. Gently lift your chest and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
Safety cue: Sit tall and draw shoulder blades together while breathing deeply

Health benefit: Increases heart rate gently and promotes lower limb coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed.
2. Lift one knee up toward hip level while swinging the opposite arm forward.
3. Lower the leg and repeat on the other side in a rhythmic marching motion.
Safety cue: Maintain upright posture and drive knees up with controlled movement and steady breathing

Health benefit: Strengthens hip flexors and quadriceps while improving lower limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and the other leg straight.
2. Tighten the thigh muscle of the straight leg.
3. Lift the straight leg to hip level while keeping it straight.
4. Hold briefly, then lower the leg slowly to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances knee mobility and promotes coordinated hip and knee movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with both knees bent and feet flat.
2. Slide one heel toward your buttocks by bending that knee.
3. Slowly straighten the leg by sliding the heel back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Slide the heel slowly while maintaining a neutral spine and engaged core

Health benefit: Improves lateral hip strength and pelvic stability during single leg tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall beside a stable support and hold it lightly.
2. Keep your torso upright and lift one leg straight out to the side.
3. Lower the leg slowly back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Stand tall, keep hips level, and lift the leg without leaning your torso

Health benefit: Increases hip external rotation range and eases gluteal muscle tension
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright in a chair with both feet flat on the floor.
2. Cross one ankle over the opposite knee to form a figure-four.
3. Lean forward from the hips with a straight back until you feel a stretch.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a long spine and avoid rounding the lower back

Health benefit: Maintains ankle range of motion and stimulates circulation in the lower leg
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with one foot lifted slightly off the floor.
2. Rotate the ankle slowly in a full circle in one direction several times.
3. Reverse the direction and rotate the ankle the same number of times.
Safety cue: Keep the knee relaxed and make controlled full ankle circles from the joint

Health benefit: Enhances balance and proprioception while strengthening ankle and hip stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Stand next to a stable support and place your hand on it.
2. Shift your weight onto one leg and lift the other foot off the ground.
3. Maintain an upright posture and hold the position.
4. Lower the lifted foot and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, engage the core, and use a support to maintain balance

Health benefit: Improves intrinsic foot strength and fine motor control of the toes
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with a small towel flat under your toes on the floor.
2. Use your toes to scrunch the towel toward you, pulling it under the foot.
3. Smooth the towel back out with your toes and repeat the scrunching.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Safety cue: Anchor the heel and curl the toes to scrunch the towel with slow control

Health benefit: Promotes gentle core engagement and enhances awareness of pelvic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Flatten your lower back against the floor by tilting your pelvis upward.
3. Hold the tilt briefly, then relax back to the neutral position.
Safety cue: Exhale as you flatten the lower back, tilting the pelvis with controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves neck range of motion and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Tilt your head to one side and bring your ear toward your shoulder.
3. Use the same-side hand to gently pull your head further for a deeper stretch.
Safety cue: Keep the shoulder down and gently tilt the head away from the side being stretched

Health benefit: Enhances upper back mobility and rotational range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands behind your head.
2. Rotate your chest and shoulders to one side while keeping your hips facing forward.
3. Return to center and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate from the mid?back while keeping the spine long

Health benefit: Improves shoulder elevation and active range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your fingers on the wall at waist height.
2. Walk your fingers upward along the wall as far as comfortable.
