1. Stand in front of a chair with feet hip-width apart and arms extended if needed.
2. Sit back toward the chair by bending at the hips and knees until your hips touch the chair lightly.
3. Press through your heels to stand back up to full extension.
4. Repeat the sit-to-stand movement with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral core muscles and improves side stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and prop your upper body on your forearm.
2. Stack your hips and knees and press into the forearm to lift your hips off the floor.
3. Hold a straight line from shoulders to knees while keeping the core engaged.
4. Lower your hips with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over elbow and lift hips into a straight line while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with feet flat and hands behind your head.
2. Arch your upper back over the chair back and lift your chest.
3. Hold briefly, then return to an upright position.
Safety cue: Sit tall and extend through the thoracic spine while keeping the core braced

Health benefit: Promotes scapular control and shoulder girdle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Pull your shoulder blades downward and slightly together.
3. Hold briefly, then release to a neutral shoulder position.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and back and avoid shrugging toward the ears

Health benefit: Enhances scapular mobility and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Slide your hands forward along the floor while keeping a neutral spine.
3. Lower your chest toward the floor as far as is comfortable without collapsing the midline.
4. Pause, then slide your hands back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral pelvis and slide the shoulders forward with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Strengthens shoulder external rotators and improves rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with the top elbow bent to 90� and a towel roll under the elbow.
2. Keep the elbow tucked to your side and hold a light weight or your hand in neutral.
3. Rotate the forearm upward away from your abdomen while keeping the elbow against the towel.
4. Lower slowly to the start position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the elbow tucked to the side and rotate slowly while stabilizing the shoulder blade

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and enhances trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lower your forearms to the floor.
2. Align shoulders over elbows and position knees under hips.
3. Engage your core and lift hips until a straight line forms from shoulders to knees.
4. Hold briefly, then lower hips back to the floor.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to hips and brace the core

Health benefit: Promotes cervical alignment and deep neck muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with shoulders relaxed and eyes forward.
2. Draw your chin straight back to create a double-chin without tilting the head.
3. Hold briefly, then relax to a neutral position.
Safety cue: Gently retract the chin keeping eyes level and lengthen the back of the neck

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and thoracic extension awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and elbows bent at your sides.
2. Press elbows and hands lightly into the floor while keeping a neutral lower back.
3. Slide your arms slowly overhead as far as is comfortable while maintaining contact.
4. Return your arms to your sides with control.
Safety cue: Keep the low back gently on the floor and move the shoulders slowly without arching

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor activation and circulation through rhythmic seated movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands on your hips or at your sides.
2. Lift one knee toward your chest in a controlled motion.
3. Lower that foot and alternate legs in a steady marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Sit tall with hips back and lift knees alternately with controlled breath

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps activation and knee joint mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a firm chair with feet flat and hands resting at sides.
2. Extend the right leg forward until the knee is almost straight.
3. Hold the extended position briefly and squeeze the thigh.
4. Lower the right foot and repeat with the left leg, alternating smoothly.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and back against the chair while extending the knee slowly

Health benefit: Enhances quadriceps engagement and improves knee stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and a small towel under one knee if needed.
2. Tighten the front thigh muscle and press the back of the knee gently into the surface.
3. Hold the contraction briefly and then relax.
Safety cue: Squeeze the thigh and press the knee into the mat while keeping the pelvis level

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductor muscles and enhances lateral pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand next to a chair and lightly hold the back for support.
2. Keep your toes pointing forward and your torso upright.
3. Lift one leg sideways a few inches without rotating the hips.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Stand tall with hips square and lift the leg without tilting the pelvis

Health benefit: Improves inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair and bring the soles of your feet together.
2. Let your knees fall outward and hold your feet with your hands.
3. Gently press your knees toward the floor and breathe calmly.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Engages lower abdominal muscles and promotes ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with heels on the floor and toes lifted.
2. Tap your toes down to the floor one foot at a time in a steady rhythm.
3. Maintain an upright posture and continue alternating taps.
Safety cue: Keep the low back neutral and lower each toe with control while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Challenges balance and improves single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand behind a chair and place both hands lightly on the back for balance.
2. Shift your weight onto one leg and bend the standing knee slightly.
3. Lift the other foot off the floor and hold the knee at hip height.
4. Lower the lifted foot and switch legs, keeping slow controlled movements.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and a soft support knee while lightly touching the chair for balance

Health benefit: Increases calf flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with one leg extended and loop a strap or towel around the ball of the foot.
2. Keep the knee straight and pull the strap toward you until you feel a stretch in the calf.
3. Hold the stretch with steady breathing and avoid bouncing.
4. Release the strap and switch to the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances postural control and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot slightly in front of the other and feet about shoulder-width apart.
2. Find a steady position and soften your knees while keeping the hips level.
3. Hold the stance for a set time, then switch the front foot.
Safety cue: Maintain hips and shoulders aligned and engage the core to control balance between the feet

Health benefit: Activates deep core muscles and promotes coordinated lower limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Engage your core and lift one knee toward your chest to a comfortable height.
3. Lower that foot and lift the other knee in a marching rhythm.
4. Keep the pelvis stable and continue alternating slowly.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace the core as you lift each knee slowly

Health benefit: Encourages gentle spinal extension and supports upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down and place your forearms on the floor with elbows under the shoulders.
2. Press through your forearms to lift your chest slightly while keeping the pelvis on the floor.
3. Hold the gentle backbend for a few breaths and then lower down.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and thoracic rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and the top arm extended straight out from the shoulder.
2. Rotate the top arm in a smooth arc overhead and across your body like a windmill.
3. Keep hips stacked and move only the arm through the range.
4. Reverse the arc back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep the top hip stacked and rotate the shoulder with slow control

Health benefit: Promotes gentle shoulder joint mobility and fluid movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lean forward and support your non?working hand on a stable surface.
2. Let the working arm hang down relaxed from the shoulder.
3. Move the hanging arm in small controlled circles.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves scapular control and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a tabletop position with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Place a towel under one hand and reach that hand diagonally forward and outward while keeping the trunk stable.
3. Slide the hand back to the starting point with control.
4. Repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Brace the core and slide the hand diagonally without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand side to a wall with your elbow bent at 90 degrees and the outer arm against the wall.
2. Press the arm outward into the wall without allowing shoulder movement.
3. Maintain the press with steady effort, then relax.
Safety cue: Press evenly into the wall keeping the shoulder blades down and avoid shrugging

Health benefit: Strengthens core and lateral trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and prop your forearm under your shoulder.
2. Stack your hips and knees and lift your hips off the ground into a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Keep the top hand on your hip and hold the position.
4. Lower the hips with control.
Safety cue: Lift the hips and maintain a straight line from knees to shoulders

Health benefit: Opens chest and improves anterior shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing into a corner and place your forearms on each wall at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest toward the corner.
3. Keep your spine neutral and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances upper back strength and scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms overhead in a Y and thumbs pointing up.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your arms off the floor a few inches.
3. Keep your neck neutral and lower the arms back down.
4. Repeat with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Keep your gaze down and lift from the shoulder blades without overextending the neck

Health benefit: Promotes knee and hip mobility through controlled flexion and extension
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with both feet flat on the floor.
2. Keep one heel in contact with the floor and slide it backward to bend the knee.
3. Slide the heel forward to return to the start and repeat.
Safety cue: Slide the heel with control and keep the pelvis stable

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with hips and knees bent and feet together.
2. Lift the top knee while keeping the feet touching and hips stacked.
3. Lower the knee slowly back to the start and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and avoid rolling the pelvis backward

Health benefit: Improves hip joint mobility and rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Drop both knees to one side while keeping both shoulders on the floor.
3. Return the knees to center.
4. Drop the knees to the opposite side and repeat.
Safety cue: Move slowly and keep the lower back gently pressed to the floor

Health benefit: Targets ankle muscles to improve inversion control and proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your feet flat and the ankle relaxed.
2. Turn the sole of the foot inward by lifting the medial edge.
3. Return the foot to neutral and repeat.
Safety cue: Stabilize the shin and invert the foot with controlled movement

Health benefit: Enhances ankle flexibility and balance during weight transfers
Steps to perform:
1. Stand holding a stable surface with feet hip-width apart.
2. Rock backward onto your heels lifting the toes, then rock forward onto your toes lifting the heels.
3. Continue rocking in a controlled manner.
Safety cue: Shift weight slowly with soft knees and an upright torso

Health benefit: Activates foot intrinsic muscles to support arch stability and toe control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with the foot flat on the floor and toes relaxed.
2. Shorten the foot by drawing the ball of the foot toward the heel to lift the arch without curling the toes.
3. Hold briefly, relax, and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep toes relaxed and curl from the ball of the foot with control

Health benefit: Challenges dynamic balance and improves lateral foot placement accuracy
Steps to perform:
1. Find a straight line on the floor or imagine one and stand at one end.
2. Step forward placing the heel of each foot directly in front of the toes of the other foot.
3. Walk slowly along the line with controlled steps.
Safety cue: Take small controlled steps while keeping an upright posture

Health benefit: Encourages spinal mobility and gentle movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand hip-width apart and place hands on your thighs.
2. Round your spine and tuck your chin toward your chest.
3. Arch your spine, lift your chest, and look forward, then repeat.
Safety cue: Move the spine smoothly with steady breaths and soft knees

Health benefit: Improves neck lateral mobility and muscle flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat on the floor.
2. Tuck your chin and rotate your head toward the same-side armpit.
3. Place the same-side hand on the back of your head and gently guide the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and shoulder blade down

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic spine rotation and core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Place one hand on the floor and rotate your torso while reaching the other hand up toward the ceiling.
3. Keep hips stable and follow your reaching hand with your eyes.
4. Return the reaching hand to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and rotate through the upper back slowly

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and upward rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place your hands on the wall at waist height and walk them upward until your arms are overhead.
3. Keep your core engaged and ribs down as you walk back down.
4. Repeat the upward and downward hand-walk with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and walk the hands up the wall with controlled motion

Health benefit: Enhances wrist extension flexibility and forearm muscle length
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm straight in front of you with the palm facing down.
2. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the fingers and hand downward toward the floor.
3. Keep the elbow straight and feel the stretch on the top of the forearm.
Safety cue: Keep the elbow extended and gently pull the wrist back until you feel a stretch

Health benefit: Develops core endurance while maintaining wrist alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Make fists and place your knuckles on the floor under your shoulders.
2. Step your feet back until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Engage your core and glutes to maintain a neutral spine.
4. Breathe steadily while holding the position.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to heels and brace the core to prevent sagging

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder muscles and improves scapular retraction
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge forward at the hips with a flat back.
2. Hold light weights or no weights with a slight bend in the elbows.
3. Lift your arms out to the sides to shoulder height while squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Lower with control and maintain the hinge.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances mid back strength and scapular stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing an open door and grasp the handle with both hands.
2. Step back to create tension and pull your elbows straight back as if rowing.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades and hold the contracted position.
4. Release slowly while maintaining steady posture.
Safety cue: Stand tall, keep elbows close, and press back against the door with steady tension

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and improves knee extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and back supported.
2. Extend one leg until the knee is straight.
3. Hold the straight position, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Sit tall and control the knee extension with a braced core

Health benefit: Activates hamstrings to enhance posterior thigh stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Dig one heel into the surface while contracting the back of the thigh.
3. Hold the contraction, then relax slowly.
Safety cue: Press the heel into the surface and keep the pelvis and low back stable

Health benefit: Improves hip abductor strength and lateral balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a chair and hold the back for support.
2. Lift the outside leg straight out to the side without tilting the torso.
3. Lower the leg with control back to the start.
Safety cue: Stand tall and lift the leg to the side without leaning the torso

Health benefit: Increases hip external rotation mobility and glute flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and cross one ankle over the opposite knee.
2. Press the crossed knee gently down to open the hip.
3. Hinge forward from the hips until you feel a gentle stretch.
Safety cue: Sit upright and hinge from the hips to keep the spine long during the stretch

Health benefit: Strengthens ankle evertors to support foot alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your foot against an immovable surface or an anchored band.
2. Push the outer edge of the foot outward without allowing visible movement.
3. Hold the push, then relax with control.
Safety cue: Keep the ankle neutral and press outward with steady controlled tension

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and controlled reaching patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your heel planted and toes free to move.
2. Move the toes and forefoot slightly toward one small clock position.
3. Return the foot to center, then repeat toward the other positions.
Safety cue: Move the leg with small controlled reaches while keeping the hips level and core engaged

Health benefit: Improves intrinsic foot strength and fine motor control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a small towel under the front of one foot.
2. Curl your toes to pull the towel toward you using your foot.
3. Smooth the towel back and repeat the scrunching action.
Safety cue: Stand with weight evenly distributed and use controlled toe flexion to scrunch the towel

Health benefit: Builds lateral hip strength and improves pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with a pillow supporting your head.
2. Keep the top leg straight and lift it upward without rotating the hips.
3. Lower the leg slowly back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and avoid rotating the torso as you lift the leg

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordinated trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hovering above the floor.
2. Brace your core and slowly extend one leg until the heel taps the surface.
3. Return that leg to start and repeat the movement with the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes lumbar mobility and gentle posterior chain stretching
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Hug both knees into your chest using your hands.
3. Hold briefly, then lower your feet back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Exhale as you draw both knees in and maintain a long neutral lumbar spine

Health benefit: Improves cervical range of motion and neck mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Slowly turn your head to look over one shoulder until you feel a gentle stretch.
3. Return to center and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Keep chin level and rotate slowly within a comfortable range

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility while promoting spinal flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit sideways on a chair with feet flat and hips level.
2. Reach one arm up then thread the opposite arm under and across toward the back of the chair.
3. Rotate your torso and look toward the raised arm while keeping your chest lifted.
4. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and thread through with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and encourages scapular movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift both shoulders toward your ears and roll them forward in a smooth circular motion.
3. Continue for the desired number of repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders relaxed and roll slowly maintaining scapular control

Health benefit: Improves finger dexterity and hand coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hand flat on a table with fingers together.
2. Lift and move each fingertip sideways one at a time to "walk" across the surface.
3. Reverse direction to return to the start position.
Safety cue: Keep wrist neutral and move fingers deliberately without collapsing the palm

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder and back extensors improving upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forehead on the mat and arms alongside your torso.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your chest a few inches while keeping your neck neutral.
3. Lower slowly back down and repeat.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades and lift using thoracic extension while keeping neck long

Health benefit: Builds biceps endurance and elbow stabilizer strength
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with your elbow bent at about 90 degrees and upper arm fixed at your side.
2. Contract your biceps and press your hand against an immovable surface without moving the elbow.
3. Hold the contraction for the desired time, then relax.
Safety cue: Keep elbow tucked by your side and maintain steady tension without swinging

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordinated contralateral limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with fists on the ground under your shoulders and knees under your hips.
2. Extend one fist forward and the opposite leg back until both are parallel to the floor.
3. Hold briefly while keeping your core stable and hips level.
4. Return to the start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips and shoulders square to the floor and extend slowly while bracing the core

Health benefit: Improves scapular retraction and shoulder external rotation mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended to the sides in a T and thumbs pointing up.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your arms a few inches off the ground while keeping your neck neutral.
3. Lower controlled back down and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and retract the shoulder blades as you lift arms into a T

Health benefit: Increases shoulder flexion range and thoracic extension
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands resting at your sides.
2. Reach both arms overhead and extend through the fingertips while keeping the chest open.
3. Lower your arms back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall with ribs stacked over hips and reach overhead without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves lower body strength and functional transfer ability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit near the front of the chair with feet hip-width apart and flat on the floor.
2. Lean slightly forward and press down through your heels to lift your hips.
3. Stand up fully by straightening your hips and knees.
4. Reverse the movement slowly and sit back down with control.
Safety cue: Push through your heels and keep your spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances quadriceps control and knee extension strength
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with a rolled towel under the back of the knee and the leg relaxed.
2. Tighten the front thigh to straighten the knee slightly and lift the heel a little.
3. Hold the contraction briefly, then slowly relax the muscle.
Safety cue: Extend the knee slowly while keeping the thigh aligned over the knee

Health benefit: Promotes glute activation and hip extension strength for improved posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing away from a wall with your hands lightly touching it for balance.
2. Brace your core and keep the standing leg slightly bent.
3. Extend one leg straight back by squeezing the glute without arching the lower back.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep your torso upright and hinge from the hip without arching your lower back

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor coordination and promotes gait patterning
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat on the floor and hands resting at your sides.
2. Lift one knee toward your chest while keeping your spine upright.
3. Lower that foot back to the floor and repeat with the other leg in a marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright pelvis and lift the knee with controlled motion

Health benefit: Increases ankle dorsiflexion range and foot clearance during walking
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or lie with the leg supported and the foot free to move.
2. Pull the toes and foot upward toward the shin using the front lower leg muscles.
3. Hold briefly at the top, then slowly lower the foot back to a neutral position.
Safety cue: Keep the heel down and pull the toes toward the shin with control

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and supports arch stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with feet flat and weight evenly distributed.
2. Draw the ball of the foot toward the heel without curling the toes to shorten the arch.
3. Hold the shortened foot position briefly, then relax.
Safety cue: Shorten the foot by drawing the ball toward the heel without curling the toes

Health benefit: Enhances ankle stability and weight transfer control during standing and walking
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Rise slowly onto your toes and hold while keeping knees soft.
3. Shift your weight back onto your heels and hold, then return to neutral.
Safety cue: Keep a tall spine and press evenly through heel and toe

Health benefit: Promotes lumbopelvic control and lower back mobility awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet about one foot away from it.
2. Tilt your pelvis to press the small of your back toward the wall.
3. Hold the tucked position briefly, then release back to neutral.
Safety cue: Tilt the pelvis to press your lower back into the wall while keeping ribs relaxed

Health benefit: Improves spinal mobility and relaxation of trunk muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Drop both knees slowly to one side while keeping your shoulders on the floor.
3. Turn your head gently to the opposite side if comfortable.
4. Return the knees to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Move your knees slowly and keep both shoulders grounded on the floor

Health benefit: Reduces neck muscle tightness and improves neck range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Place one hand behind your back and use the other hand to tilt your head away from that side.
3. Keep the opposite shoulder down and maintain a gentle pull.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and tilt from the top of the neck without shrugging the shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and improves posture alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit near the edge of a chair with feet flat and hands behind your head.
2. Lean back over the top of the chair back while lifting your chest and keeping elbows wide.
3. Return to upright with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis neutral and hinge from the thoracic spine rather than arching the lower back

Health benefit: Promotes scapular control and supports shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your hands on the wall at shoulder height with arms straight.
2. Keep your arms straight and pull your shoulder blades down away from your ears.
3. Hold the depressed position and then relax to neutral.
Safety cue: Draw shoulders down away from the ears and focus on scapular depression with control

Health benefit: Improves scapular upward rotation and shoulder mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and hips against a wall and press the backs of your hands and forearms to the wall.
2. Keep contact with the wall and slide your arms upward by extending at the shoulders.
3. Reverse the motion by sliding your arms back down while maintaining contact.
4. Repeat with slow controlled movements.
Safety cue: Keep forearms and wrists in contact with the wall and slide using scapular motion only

Health benefit: Strengthens shoulder external rotators and improves joint stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one elbow bent at 90 degrees and the elbow tucked to your side near a wall.
2. Press the back of your hand into the wall as if trying to rotate your forearm outward and resist the motion.
3. Maintain the isometric contraction and then relax.
Safety cue: Tuck elbow to 90 degrees and rotate externally without elevating the shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances forearm rotational mobility and functional wrist control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with elbow bent at 90 degrees and the forearm supported at your side.
2. Rotate your forearm to turn your palm up toward the ceiling in a controlled motion.
3. Reverse the motion to turn the palm down and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep elbow at your side and rotate the forearm slowly with control

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and trains shoulder and wrist stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your knuckles on the wall at shoulder height, shoulder-width apart.
2. Step your feet back until your body forms a straight line from head to heels and brace your core.
3. Hold the plank position while keeping the knuckles pressed into the wall and the spine neutral.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Opens anterior chest and supports improved breathing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall and interlace your fingers behind your back with palms together.
2. Straighten your arms and squeeze your shoulder blades together while lifting your chest.
3. Keep the neck long and hold the expanded position.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together to open the chest while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Increases latissimus flexibility and enhances overhead reach
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel facing a bench or stable surface and place one forearm on the bench with the hand flat.
2. Keep the supporting knee under your hip and reach your hips back toward your heels.
3. Allow your torso to lower and lengthen over the bench arm to stretch the side of the ribcage.
4. Breathe steadily and switch sides after completing the set.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and reach through the arm while maintaining a long, aligned spine

Health benefit: Promotes whole body mobility and facilitates muscular tension release
Steps to perform:
1. Lie flat on your back with legs extended and arms reaching overhead toward the wall behind you.
2. Actively lengthen through your fingertips and toes by reaching in opposite directions.
3. Hold the extended position while keeping your spine neutral.
4. Relax your arms and legs and return to a resting position.
Safety cue: Lengthen from fingertips to toes and breathe steadily while keeping the core engaged

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps and gluteal muscle activation for lower limb strength
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with knees bent and feet flat on the footplate or wall.
2. Press your feet into the plate or wall without moving your legs.
3. Hold the press and keep the muscles engaged for the set time.
4. Relax slowly and breathe normally between repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and press evenly through both heels

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductor muscles to improve lateral hip stability and control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with the bottom leg bent and the top leg straight.
2. Lift the top straight leg upward away from the bottom leg in a controlled motion.
3. Lower the leg slowly back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Anchor your lower back to the mat and lift through the hip without rotating

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor strength and thigh muscle coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with both legs straight and the top leg slightly forward.
2. Bend the top knee and lift the top thigh forward toward your torso.
3. Lower the leg back slowly to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core engaged to prevent rolling

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor length and hip extension mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with one knee on the ground and the other foot flat in front at 90 degrees.
2. Tuck your pelvis slightly and shift your weight forward until you feel a stretch in the front hip.
3. Hold the position and keep your torso upright.
4. Return to start and switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso and gently tuck the pelvis during the stretch

Health benefit: Builds calf muscle strength and ankle plantarflexion power
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with knees bent and loop a resistance band around the ball of one foot.
2. Press your toes and forefoot away from you against the band until your ankle points.
3. Return to neutral slowly and repeat.
Safety cue: Control the ankle motion and avoid bouncing through the range

Health benefit: Enhances balance and ankle proprioception on unstable surfaces
Steps to perform:
1. Stand barefoot on a soft surface like a foam pad and lift one foot off the ground.
2. Keep your hips level and focus on a fixed point ahead.
3. Hold the position for the desired time, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep a slight bend in the standing knee and maintain a level pelvis

Health benefit: Increases toe and forefoot mobility and intrinsic muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your foot supported and the ankle relaxed.
2. Use your hand to gently lift and extend the toes upward toward the shin.
3. Hold the stretch briefly and release slowly.
Safety cue: Stabilize the ankle and lift the toes deliberately without compensating elsewhere

Health benefit: Promotes gait precision and improves foot placement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Place a straight piece of tape on the floor and stand at one end.
2. Walk forward placing the heel of one foot directly in front of the toes of the other foot on the line.
3. Continue walking the length of the tape with slow, controlled steps.
Safety cue: Walk slowly heel-to-toe with eyes forward and controlled posture

Health benefit: Encourages thoracic extension and improves upper back mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands under your shoulders and elbows close to your sides.
2. Press through your hands to lift your chest a small distance while keeping your hips on the floor.
3. Lower your chest back down slowly and relax.
Safety cue: Keep the hips grounded and extend the thoracic spine with slow controlled movement
